column1: fuller on off, no swing, he clips this neatly wide of mid on, he places this and times it nicely to get off the mark and they run well
nasty short ball, he fends it at, it comes off the upper arm and falls safely behind him. Brutal one first up
good length outside off, he pushes at a drive and it runs off a thick edge behind point for a couple
fuller and wide of off, a hint of shape away, he's happy to leave
back of a length on middle, he's back and across and defending into the on side
very full speared into leg stump, he digs this out past short leg for a single
pops up a length ball just wide of short leg! It was a good length, climbing and hitting the sticker of the bat, it just ballooned wide of Harris and away for one
good length, angled across the left-hander, 135kph, he leaves
back of a length into leg stump, he defends with soft hands past short leg and they take a sharp one
135kph, good length inswinger, he shoulders arm, it strikes the pad, a big appeal for LBW, but it's given not out. Too high and no review from Australia
fuller and swinging into leg stump, he glances this neatly to fine leg
fuller outside off, shaping back and he defends on the front foot to mid off
edged and just short of third slip! Good length, shaping away a touch, he pushes hard gets a thick edge and it lands just short of Labuschagne at third and it gets through him for one
over-steps, it's wide of off and he's happy to leave
full almost yorker length on off, 135kph, he defends this towards mid on
143kph, short ball wide of off, he drops the hands lets it fly past well wide
138kph, full and sprayed down the leg side, no swing there
full toss outside off, it swings away very late, he drives and misses
full and tailing down leg, he glances this easily to fine leg for a single
big appeal for LBW, given not out. This is swinging back down the line, beats the inside edge and hits the back thigh. Richardson thought it was high and signalled to Paine not to review
good length shaping in, he defends on the front foot
good length but too straight on leg, he clips this neatly though midwicket for a couple
good length, fourth stump line, shaping back down the line, he leaves, it's tight but a good leave
good length across the left-hander, he leaves this alone
fuller swinging back in, he tries to whip square gets an inside edge onto pad. No appeal as everyone heard the edge.
144kph, full and straight and a hint of shape, he tries to work to leg, closes the face, gets a thick leading edge through cover for one
searing short ball, seaming back in, he sways underneath late, like a limbo! But he gets his head just out of the way as it flies past his eyes!
full on leg, he glances this fine to fine leg
beaten by a beauty, back of a length seaming away, he was squared up completely
145kph, good length on off, he pushes on the front foot to mid off
over-steps, 146kph good length off stump, he pushes to mid off

LBW! 200 Test wickets for Starc! Thirimanne reviews. Fuller length, nipping back off the seam. No bat involved as he caught on the crease hit on the knee roll in front of the stumps. Hawkeye has it missing leg stump! Not out! The decision is overturned!
good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
135kph, fuller outside off, shaping back a fraction, he tries to drive, gets a thick inside edge onto pad and it rolls away
138kph, good length, angled across, he lets this pass to the keeper
136kph, bouncer, very short and called wide for being too high. That ball ballooned off the surface
136kph, good length across the left hander, he leaves this alone
135kph, good length on middle and leg, he turns this off the front foot behind square
short ball fired well down the leg side and he shows no interest in playing at it
144kph, good length angled into middle and leg he turns this off the front foot with the angle to fine leg
141kph, short ball, bouncer, he ducks under this easily
142kph, good length, zipping past the edge as it nipped away. He just prodded at it from the crease
148kph, fuller outside off, he drives firmly back to the bowler
145kph, back of a length well wide of off, he leaves this alone
full outswinger wide of off, he throws the hands at a square drive but misses
136kph, good length but pushed way wide of off and he leaves
138kph full and swinging into leg stump, he glances nicely to fine leg

back of a length, glanced off the hip fine of Starc running around at fine leg. Did Starc touch the rope as he slip on his knees and stopped the ball? He did with his other hand while touching the ball. Four runs
shorter length on off, he stands up and defends with soft hands to the gap at cover and takes a single
beaten by the angle across him. 139kph, good length, angling across, he defends on the front foot and it goes past the edge
136kph, bouncer, he sees it early and ducks underneath it
good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
133kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot
good length, fifth stump line, he presses forward and defends to point
fuller outside off, he attempts to drive but gets a thick inside edge onto pad
bouncer, over off stump, he ducks underneath it
good length outside off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
good length on off, he defends off the thick inside half of the bat to square leg
back of a length on off, he is back and defending
bouncer, well directed but very short and he ducks under it
134kph, good length, pitching outside leg, hit him in the top of the pad as he tries to work behind square
133kph, good length, he pushes this away from his body to backward point
good length, on off, he defends on the front foot with soft hands
138kph, full outside off, he drives hard at it wobbles away off the seam to beat the flashing edge

caught at third slip! Labuschagne pouches it. Almost identical ball to the previous one, full and angled in, it hits the seam and nibbles away, he drives hard at it, gets a thick edge that flies straight to third slip and Labuschagne clutches it to his chest
139kph, good length angled into off, he pushes off the front foot wide of mid on
another bouncer, targeting the body but he ducks under it early and it flies through harmlessly
good length 142kph, angled in towards off, he defends solidly off the front foot
142kph, good length wide of off, he defends on the front foot away from his body, guiding it into the gully
135kph, good length outside off, just tails away late but he leaves it alone
beaten sparring at a good length wide of off. He didn't need to play, just prodded at it as it nips away
edged with soft hands and it runs between third slip and gully! Good length, nipping away he is squared up a touch on the front foot but his hands were soft and he gets four
137kph, fuller length on off, he pushes on the front foot to mid off, off balance a touch,
back of a length angled into off, he's back and across and defending to mid on

caught at second slip! First Test wicket for Richardson. And a beauty! Angled in to off, nipping away from a good length, he has to play, tries to defend with firm hands, gets a healthy edge that goes low to second slip, Burns moves well to his left and takes an excellent catch.
139kph full toss, he drives firmly back to the bowler
141kph, back of a length outside off stump, he's back and defending to his feet
139kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
143kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
139kph, shorter outside off, he defends away from his body on the back foot
good length, fourth stump line, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
length ball, wide outside off, and left alone
four slips and a gully before this ball, and he bowls full just outside off. Mendis is looking to defend inside the delivery's line, and the ball whizzes past his outside edge
full and wide outside off, but angling in. Forces Mendis to come forward to defend. Played towards cover
bowling from wide of the crease. Full outside off, and he presses forward before shouldering his arms
wide, outside off, and angling away from Mendis. Could've chosen to cut, but opts to leave it alone again
full on off stump, and he puts his front foot outside the wickets, before driving through the ball's line. Hit straight back to mid-on though
bowling from round the wicket to the left-hander. Full outside off, and he strides forward for the cover drive. Protection in the deep though
full outside off again, and easily shoveled through the covers. Chase for the fielder at a square-ish cover
length ball angling in, and defended off the back foot to the off side. They scamper across for one
length ball, just outside off, and it teases Mendis! Ball holds its line as Mendis looks to defend, and it once again beats his outside edge
back of a length just outside off, and Mendis looks to defend off the back foot, before pulling his bat back
full and wide outside off, and easy decision for Mendis. Leaves the ball alone after facing a couple of challenging deliveries
full on off, and spinning away from the batsman. Spins past his outside edge much to Tim Paine's delight
full on middle, and the offbreak is blocked away to point
full on off, and he presses forward tentatively with the angled bat. Played behind square on the off side
length ball, wide outside off, and he backs away to cut. But Karunaratne misses the shot and Tim Paine pouches the ball
full just outside off, and he comes forward to defend again. Played past the fielder at short mid off
finally some release. Full outside off, and driven with the turn to wide mid-off. Just a single, but wait, it's overthrows at the keeper's end! They come back for the second
length ball, just outside off, and Mendis is squared up! Tries to defend off the back foot after covering his off stump, but the ball goes past his outside edge
length ball, wide outside off, and he bunts a square cut to point. Finds the fielder however
full outside off, and that's a beautiful cover drive that finds the fielder. Cummins wouldn't mind that... 'get the batsman driving'
back of a length just outside off, and that sends Mendis ducking
teasing full ball outside off, and Mendis tentatively steps forward to drive. But, once again, whizzing past his outside edge
finally off the mark! Back of a length outside off, but he rides the bounce to punch through the off side. Chase for third man around the boundary, and they collect three easily
full just outside off, and turning into Mendis. Worked away to the leg side
full outside off, and he walks down the ground, before bunting a drive to long on
full on off from round the wicket. Ball drifting in and defended
length ball spinning away, and he backs away to cut. Mistimed to point, but they choose not to run
full on off, and he pushes this with the bat's open face to silly mid off
full on middle, and nudged off his toes to midwicket. They want the single, but too dangerous a choice.
full just outside off, and a much more confident shot from Mendis. Nice big stride and defended
length ball into his body, and he rocks back using the crease's depth to block the ball away
tests him with the short ball, but not well directed. Length's outside the stumps, and Mendis easily ducks
back of a length, outside off stump, and left alone. Nice carry through to Paine
full and very wide outside off stump. Mendis throws his bat at this, but the offcutter beats the outside edge of his bat
length ball, wide outside off, and he rides the bounce to muscle a cut square through the off side!
full on middle, and worked away to cover
full on leg stump, and into his pads. Nudged off his hips to the vacant square-leg region
full on middle and leg, and Karunaratne blocks with soft hands
full on leg stump, and defended towards short mid off. Tentatively playing at this, with two close-in fielders on the off side
length ball on leg stump. The slider raps him on the back leg, but impact's outside the stumps
full on off, and turning away. He opens the bat's face to push towards point, and steals a single with ease
length ball, just wide outside off and he throws his hands at him to punch through the off side
length ball, just wide outside off, and he shoulders his arms
full toss, low on middle, and clipped away through the leg side! Ball races away to the midwicket boundary
full on off, and he bunts this back to mid off
back of a length, just outside off stump, and he sways away from the line of the ball
length ball, just wide outside off, and he shoulder his arms this time after walking across to the off side
length ball, just outside off and turning inwards. Blocked off the back foot
length ball on leg stump, hits the top of his pads and lobs into the air. Shouts of 'catch it', but no contact off the bat
length ball on leg again, and swiped away to fine leg for a walking single
full just outside off stump, and squirted away off the back foot to point
full on middle, and he drives with the bat's straight face. Finds mid-off though
third one! Teasing ball, length delivery outside off, and he tries to get his bat back after trying to defend. But it's taken a glove-touch, and Paine takes a very sharp catch
overpitched on middle, and while Mendis comes forward to drive, it's converted into a full toss. Looks to drive straight, but mistimes to mid off
length ball, just outside off, and angling away from his body. Left alone
shot! Ball outside off and going further away, and Mendis presses forward elegantly to drive through the off side. Lyon gives it a massive chase, and manages to save Australia one run
length ball, on off stump, and he rides the bounce to defend
wide outside off, and Roshen chooses to check-drive, but the ball has beaten his outside edge by the time he brings the bat down
length ball on middle that generates some extra bounce. He sways away from the ball's line, and lets it go to Paine
length ball on off, and turning into his body. Rocks back, deep into his crease and defends
full on leg stump, and he looks to work it away to the leg side after opening his stance. But ball hits his back leg
length ball on leg stump, and nudged off the back foot towards the off side
length ball on leg stump, and whipped with the spin to leg slip. But importantly, played along the ground
full just outside off, and he takes a big stride forward to block with the straight bat. Beats Lyon, and that allows Mendis to walk across for one
length ball, just outside off, and he mistimes a cut to point
full on off stump, and he offers the bat's straight face to drive. Struck well, but straight back to the bowler
length ball on the fourth-stump line. Mendis covers his off stump and shoulders his arms
full outside off, and he bends his knees to drive closer to the ground. Finds cover point however
back of a length on leg stump, but going further down leg. Mendis swivels and sees the ball go through into Mendis' gloves
full just outside off, and the outswinger is driven through to mid-off's right. A running effort from the fielder saves Australia certainly two, maybe four
full on off, and he reaches forward to meet the ball halfway near the pitch. Defended
shouts of 'catch it' as Roshen pads a defensive shot towards the leg side. Ball in the air as Labuschagne dives from short leg
length ball, on middle stump, and he rocks back to block off the back foot
length ball on middle, and turning into Roshen. Allows the ball to hit his body
full on off, and he takes a big stride forward to defend. Well negated, and he goes into tea unbeaten on zero.
133kph, fuller outside off, he pushes firmly on the front foot straight to mid off, that was nicely timed
135kph, full on middle and off, he pushes firmly again on the front foot straight into the stumps at the non-striker's end
Bowled him! What a cracker! Angled in at good pace, pitching off, shaping away late, he is squared up completely defending on the crease, it beats the edge and smashes into off stump!
beats him!138kph fuller outside off, he prods at it and it shapes past the edge
137kph, good length angled into off, he's back and across and defending
leading edge closing the face balloons just short of point! Another ball angling in and shaping away, he closed the face but the leading edge fells well short of the man
tossed up outside off, he skips down and drives back to the bowler
good length off break on leg, he defends on the front foot to short leg
beaten by a faster off break that slides on with the arm, it bounces and Paine can't take it cleanly
he skips down the track and defends with pad bat tucked in behind and it balloons away
tossed up on middle, he skips down and works to mid on
shorter length on leg, he's back and tucking this past short leg
137kph, back of a length fourth stump line, he defends off the back foot covering off stump
135kph, good length wide of off, he's back and defending away from his body prodding this to point
132kph, shorter and wider, he cuts firmly straight to point
138kph, good length, he's squared up going back and across to defend
137kph, good length, top of off, he wants to work to the on side but gets a slight leading edge that rolls back to the bowler
133kph, good length outside off stump, he raises the bat high and allows it to go through to the keeper
sharp turn and bounce leaps up! It comes off his bicep and drops down! He went back to cut and it just spat at him! Wow
tossed up on middle and off, he skips out and turns this to midwicket
pushed through quicker, 88kph on middle, he defends from the crease
good length on leg, spinning sharply, he raises the bat and lets it hit the thigh guard
fuller on leg, he clips this wide of midwicket and they finally get a run
87kph, full on off, he pushes with the turn gently to mid on who is halfway to the rope and they get an easy one
138kph, good length, off stump line, he stands tall and defends on the back foot
short ball, outside off, he pulls but not convincingly wide of mid on
136kph, good length wide of off, he leaves comfortably off the back foot
136kph, fuller outswinger, a tempter wide of off, but he's not tempted to play
135kph, good length wide of off, he leaves again comfortably out of the hand
138kph, bouncer, very short, he ducks under it easily
good length, 87kph off break on off stump, he defends from the crease
he advances to defends and edges past slip! It was well wide of him and runs fine to third man. Long chase for Khawaja. It just slid on with the arm and caught the edge as he prodded at it
skips down to the pitch and whips this firmly to midwicket
88kph fractionally shorter, not that wide but he's back and dabbing a late cut using the pace to run it past backward point
he skips down to an 85kph off break, turns this with the spin to forward square
looped high on off, 82kph, he reaches forward and defends smothering the spin
137kph, back of a length on off, he's back and across and defending comfortably
wide of the crease, 139kph, back of a length angled into off, he defends off the back foot once more

caught behind! Superb bowling! He set him up. Back of a length, back of a length, and then a fuller 135kph, out-swinger tempting him into a drive, he just pushes at it but his weight was back and he moved late, got a thin edge as it swung away, easy catch for Paine
141kph, good length angled across, he's happy to leave this alone
138kph, good length wide of off, he's happy to leave again
beaten by a 135kph length ball that nips away from him! High class from Richardson
87kph, shorter length, sharp turn, he's back trying to force through the off side but chops it into the leg side
tossed up on leg, he's forward and defending
a reverse sweep! Beautifully played brooming this fine of backward point! It was full outside off and he played a textbook reverse sweep to the big gap
fuller on off, he's forward and defending
shorter length outside off, he's back and punching to point with a vertical back
good length on middle and off, he defends from the crease
137kph, fuller and wider, he leans into a drive through the gap at cover, a positive stroke for a couple
good length, angled across and he leaves this alone
good length, outside off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
137kph, good length angled across, he is beaten hanging the bat out and withdrawing it after it passed
good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
138kph, bouncer, he tries to pull from an awkward position, half ducking half pulling but is beaten for pace as it flies over his shoulder
tossed up, on off, he shuffles down and defends
fuller on middle and leg, he defends with the turn to short leg
floated up outside off, he defends with soft hands to the gap at cover and they take one
tossed up, 87kph, he defends off the front foot to silly mid off
floated up very high, he edges a drive past slip towards third man and Head has a long chase to haul it in
91kph, quicker and shorter, he's back trying to force through cover but mistimes it
fuller outside off, he drives with an open face to point
over-pitched and he crunches a glorious drive straight of mid off! 137kph half-volley and he presented the full face and punched it straight back past the bowler with power
139kph, good length wide of off, he's prepared to leave this one
135kph, back of a length, he's squared up defending, gets an edge but it goes straight down between second slip and gully, the outfield is a bit slow and it gets hauled in
138kph, back of a length, he's squared up again slicing a defensive push to gully
beaten prodding on the front foot at a 138kph length ball outside off. It just held it's line rather than shaping in
91kph, good length outside off, he defends on the front foot
looped up higher and slower, 85kph, he skips down and whips this through midwicket nicely to the sweeper

dropped by Head at backward point! He reverse sweeps, there's extra bounce, he scoops it high to the left of Head at backward point, he jumps up with the left hand and it hits his wrist and drops down!
shorter length on off, he's back and defending
shorter length spinning in, going down leg, he's back and raising the bat, letting it hit his thigh guard
good length spinning in, he pushes this to cover
back of a length on off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
140kph, back of a length angled in and nipping away and he's beaten! It just nips past the edge
back of a length on off, he defends off the back foot, it comes off a thick inside edge through square leg to the sweeper
good length, 138kph, wide of off, he leaves this alone
good length on off, he defends on the front foot with soft hands to the gap at cover, he wants one but Dickwella sends him back
beaten again pushing forward defending at a good length outside off. He practices his leave after it flies to the keeper
drifting down leg, he sweeps fine and it beats the diving Starc! Well played by Dickwella, he hit down on it, getting it fine of the man at short fine leg
big drive and miss at an 84kph off break looped up and spinning sharply outside off
good length off break on off, he defends to silly mid off
attempts to sweep, gets it off the toe end of the bat to midwicket
shorter length outside off, it spins sharply and he leaves
he sweeps a length ball from wide of off to deep square
length ball, wide outside off, and left alone first up
back of a length on off, and coming into Dickwella. He tries to open the bat's face and ramp it over third man, but can't make the connection with his bat
what happened there? Length ball outside off, but jagging in very sharply. Dickwella had shouldered his arms, but the ball had other plans. Raps him on the back pad, but impact was too high
length ball, wide outside off, and he comfortably sees this through to the keeper
full just outside off, and he half-walks to the pitch of the ball, before check-driving to cover
length ball, just outside off, but angling into Dickwella. Defended off the front foot as the ball rolls back to Cummins
whoa. Full toss on middle stump, and Roshen's defensive shot takes an outside edge to third man. Ball slipped because of the humidity, perhaps?
length ball just outside off, and he covers his off stump, before shouldering his arms
full on middle, and he comfortably bunts this ball back past the non-striker. Head, at mid off, intercepts
full on off, and the delivery boomerangs away from Roshen after hitting the deck. He stuck his bat out to defend with the angled bat, but the ball goes past his blade on this occasion
back of a length on off, and angling away from Roshen. He sways away from the line of the ball
full just outside off, and pushed away from his body to cover

single pinched. Back of a length on off, and tapped away to the off side. Cummins gives it a chase, and throws it towards the keeper's stumps while diving to his right, but the ball wasn't aimed well. If Cummins had hit, then Silva was definitely going back for an early dinner
back of a length on middle, and Roshen swiftly ducks under the ball's line
length ball, just outside off, and oh-so-close to the top of off stump. But Roshen calculates his leave, offering no shot as the ball goes through to Paine

full just outside off, and that's taken a feather edge! Fiery Cummins strikes, finally rewarded for some excellent bowling to Silva. Silva once again half-heartedly moves forward to defend, but a bit of away movement finds his outside edge. Falls for 9, after spending close to ten overs in the centre
length ball just outside off, and the ball holds its line on this occasion. Perera looks to defend, but can't get bat on ball
again beats the outside edge! A terrific over from Cummins. Fullish ball outside off, and Perera comes forward to defend. But once again, he's too late into the shot
full on off, and he gets onto the back foot, before pushing a shot to mid on. A dangerous single, but they easily complete it in the end
full just outside off, and he tries to check-drive towards cover But the ball angling away finds the outside edge but unfortunately for Australia... lands short of Labuschagne at third slip
full on off stump again, and Perera defends with soft hands this time. Takes the outside edge again, but goes along the ground to third slip
length ball on off, and he stands tall to black off the back foot
back of a length on middle, but angling down the leg side. Dickwella swivels and allows the ball to go through to the keeper
length ball, wide outside off, but doesn't come in as much. Perera covers his off stump and shoulders his arms
full just outside off, and this time the ball snakes past Perera's outside edge. Just a bit of away movement that makes Cummins miss the outside edge

Perera drops his bat and opens his gloves right away! Not good for Sri Lanka, Perera is clutching his right-hand's thumb. That's his bowling hand. Short ball that didn't rise as much and Perera's attempt to work towards the leg side hits his right glove. Ball was in the air for a while too, and short leg could've taken a catch if it was nearer to him. Marcus Harris the fielder
full on middle, and clipped off his pads to deep midwicket. Work for the man in the deep, and that allows Lakmal to come back for the third!
length ball, wide outside off, and left alone by Dickwella
full on off, and worked off his pads to the vacant square-leg region for a walking single. Phew, that was a long over
full on leg stump, and clipped away to deep backward square for a single
length ball on middle, but swaying down the leg side. Lakmal tries to work it off his pads, but the ball's too far way
full and wide outside off, and that's been slapped through the off side! Allows Lakmal to free his arms, and he cuts it to the deep-point boundary. Hundred for Sri Lanka

Starc's 200th! And this time the wicket will stand. Full from round the wicket on off stump, and he tries to block this off the front foot. But the ball moves away slightly after pitching, and the outside edge is taken by Labuschagne at third slip. Catch taken very close to the grass, but it's clean
welcomed with a full ball on off stump, and defended back to Starc. Perera shakes the pain off his hand
back of a length outside off, and Perera allows it to go past his shoulder to the keeper
full outside off, and left alone. Boomerang bounce through to the keeper

full outside off, and he shovels a drive past cover's right. Chase from Head to the extra-cover boundary, and he does well to parry the ball back. Lyon ran with him for support, and he throws the ball back to the keeper
back of a length outside off, and he rides the bounce to block off the back foot
full just outside off, and he brings his bat down hard to punch through the off side. Intercepted at cover
full on off, and angling in, and defended with the bat's straight face to mid on
length ball, wide outside off, and seaming away from the batsman. He leaves it alone
overpitched wide outside off, and Dickwella's attempted drive takes the edge to the slip cordon. But the ball bounced way before it reached Burns at second slip
length ball on off stump, and the back-foot defense flies away towards point on the off side
back of a length on middle, and cramping Dickwella. But he manages to work this off his hips to the leg side for a single

third slip! Perera finally gone, and it's a wicket that forces Perera to make his way back, not some body blow. Starc bowled full outside off, and the attempted straight drive took a thick outside edge to Labuschagne. Perera paying the price for playing inside the ball's line
full on middle, and the leg-side nudge takes a leading edge to point instead

full just outside off, and Starc is appealing for caught-behind! It was a full ball that was bowled just outside off stump, and the ball goes through to the keeper with the batsman trying to defend. Starc believes there's a tiny edge, and Paine is convinced. Australia review and while there's nothing on HotSpot the TV umpire wants to check with snicko as well.... and nope, no contact. Marais Erasmus, the on-field umpire, was spot on
attempted ramp that doesn't come off. Length ball on middle, and Dickwella walks across the stumps to play the innovating shot. But he's been done in by some extra bounce
length ball on middle, and Dickwella backs away before sticking his bat out to defend towards mid-off

full just outside off, but it's the slower ball from Richardson. Drags a swipe from outside the stumps to midwicket, and that area is pretty empty. Allows Dickwella to keep the tailender at the non-striker's
back of a length on off, and he tries to drag a pull along the ground. But the ball whizzes over his bat's face
length ball on off, and he paddles a check-pull to the leg side. Top-edged towards midwicket, but the ball lands just short. Livin' dangerously here...
back of a length just outside off, and Chameera smartly sways away from the ball's line
full on leg stump, and he backs away before bunting a lifted cover drive over the infield! Teasing chase for Head to the boundary, but the ball wins the race this time
length ball on leg stump, and Dickwella exposes all three stumps, before slicing a punch behind square. Chase for deep point this time
ramped! Right over the keeper's head for six. Full on off, and Dickwella shuffles across, down on one knee, and sends this for six over the least likeliest spot on the cricket field
length ball just outside off, and he backs away again before punching to cover. Displaying all three stumps once again
yep, it's an attempted yorker on middle. Dickwella swings across the line, and inside-edges to fine leg
full just outside off and Chameera chooses to give this ball a whack. Tries to drive, but misses the shot, and Paine pounces the ball. That's time for dinner
136kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone through to Paine
he advances and swings hard but gets thick inside edge that flies past leg stump to fine leg, he turns down the single. He wants the strike
backs away and misses trying to slash this 138kph short ball over point
he slashes this one up and over backward point! Gets the same length and width and he stays more stable and slaps this up and over point! Nicely done
141kph, better length, wide of off, he clears the front leg and pokes at it but misses
he moves around the crease and then dabs a length ball down to third man for one to keep the strike for the next over
straighter line, he paddle sweeps fine, fine leg is back and they don't take the single
he sweeps from outside off and strikes this well behind square and it beats Burns diving on the rope! 50 for Dickwella. Excellent innings. It's his 11th fifty in Test cricket
84kph, full on off, he paddle sweeps again to fine leg and takes the single this time
shorter length, 89kph, outside off, he's back and defending
looped up higher, he's forward and defending to cover-point
good length off break, he leans forward and defends with soft hands
sets up for the DilScoop again, ramps it onto pad and it just misses the stumps and bounces to Paine! Brave shot to a 138kph length ball. But he's already hit one for six
139kph bouncer, he pulls on the walk, not in control, gets a top edge that flies just wide and short of Harris at deep square! No single taken
walks down again, banged in short, he miscues a pull shot that just clears midwicket and they get a couple
140kph, good length, wide of off, he tries to cut but misses
shorter length, over middle, he backs away to upper cut over slip but misses
139kph, bouncer, he backs away and plays a jumping tennis smash type shot swatting it to point
88kph tossed up outside off, he presses forward to defend
shorter length, a bit of bounce, he knocks it down off the glove to leg slip
86kph, shorter, he's back and knocking this down again to short leg
good length off break, he defends from the crease again
tossed up on off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
85kph fuller on middle, he defends on the front foot
top edged pull flies over the keeper! It was banged in, he swung hard, gets a top edge that goes straight over Paine's head and bounces over the rope. No fielder there
back of a length wide of off, he tries to lift this up and over gully but misses
140kph, back of a length, in the arc and he heaves this over wide mid on, doesn't nail it but hits it well enough for two
140kph, short into the body, he plays a controlled pull, rolling this around to deep square and they take one this time
141kph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it well
beaten by a beauty! A late swinging full delivery at 138kph, that just tailed away past the edge
he reverse sweeps firmly to deep point and opts not to take the run on offer
he skips down the track and lofts this inside out over cover, wide of long off for two. Lovely stroke
he sweeps conventionally to deep backward square for one
tossed up on middle, he defends on the front foot
80kph, slower and higher, he is back and covering up in defence
good length off break, he presses forward and defends
134kph, bouncer, very high and angled down leg, he shapes to pull but just watches it fly over his head

caught at midwicket! Dickwella falls trying to find the rope. It was banged in back of a length, he tries to pull over midwicket who was halfway to the rope, it came off the toe of the bat and flew to Patterson at midwicket who back-pedalled but took a fairly easy catch. His first catch in Tests
138kph, bouncer, he ducks underneath

caught at gully! Cummins wraps up the innings. Another short ball, he tries to pull, gets a top edge that balloons straight up to gully and Patterson takes a couple of steps back and another easy catch
126kph, inswinger, good length, he pushes on the front foot and it goes in the air for a bit towards mid on
good length, 130kph, shaping into middle, he tucks this easily past short leg behind square for two
131kph, good length shaping back into off, he defends on the front foot
130kph, shorter length wide of off, he's up on his toes defending away from his body with soft hands
131kph, full on the pads, he clips this powerfully into the shoulder of short leg, no chance to catch it, it was middled and hit him before he could move, it runs away for three
130kph, good length out-swinger, he presses forward and defends with a slightly open face to point
135kph, full on off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
142kph, back of a length on leg, he clips this neatly from the crease wide of mid on for one
good length, 141kph, wide of off, he leaves this alone
141kph, good length wide of off, he leaves again on the front foot
136kph, full out-swinger, not a huge amount of swing, but way wide, he leaves again
wide of the crease, 142kph, angled into off, he drives on the front foot to mid on
129kph, good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot to cover
132kph, angled down leg side, he tries to glance but misses
whipped elegantly in the air behind square and it beats Kumara rolling on the rope! It was full and swinging into the pads and he picked this off with a lovely whip of the wrists
132kph, full and swinging in late, he gets an inside edge onto pad driving firmly at it
shorter into the hip, it comes off the thigh guard and runs behind square for a leg bye
beaten sparring at a good length ball shaping away outside off. He just shuffled across and wafted at it
142kph, good length outside off, he defends with an open faced blade, it runs past point, they take a while before deciding there's an easy one on offer
good length wide of off, he leaves this alone outside off
over-pitched and beautifully driven wide of mid off, he just leaned on it and timed it very nicely to pick up a boundary
143kph, back of a length, nipping in and it hits him on the thigh pad
144kph, good length on off, he presses forward and defends well
back of a length on off, he's back and defending
131kph, full and swinging late into the front pad, they appeal for LBW, but it was shaping well down leg. Not out and they abandoned the appeal
132kph, shorter length wide of off, he punches off the back foot to point
130kph, full on off, he pushes on the front to cover
129kph, good length swinging into leg, he works this off the pad to midwicket
130kph, good length swinging into off, he defends on the front foot with the swing into the on side
131kph, good length, he makes a positive stride into the ball and pushes firmly to mid off
short ball and Burns loves these, hammering this chest high offering through square leg to the fence! He's a good puller and hooker. Particularly on his home track
145kph short again and he hooks this easily again wide of fine leg, Chameera runs around on the rope and gets there but makes a mess of the diving save it rolls into the rope
143kph, nipping back from a good length, into the thigh guard and rolls into the off side
144kph, good length angling in, tight leave but a very good, it swings after it passes the stumps and Dickwella has to knock it down diving left
143kph, fuller outside off, he plays a rock solid forward defence
142kph, good length but well side of off, he raises the bat and lets this pass
132kph, good length on middle and leg, he defends easily from the crease to mid on
beaten by one that nips away! 129kph, good length but this hits the seam pitching on off and zips way past the edge
inside edge just flies past leg stump! He was driving at 135kph, inswinger, he drives and gets a thick inside edge it just goes past leg stump, they get two to fine leg
132kph, good length on leg, he tucks this off the thigh pad to square leg
130kph, swinging down leg and he glances this fine, too easy, and finds another boundary
130kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone on the back foot
short ball outside off, he pulls firmly but straight to mid on
135kph, good length out-swinger wide of off, he leaves this alone
back of a length, out-swinger wide of off, he leaves off the back foot
into leg stump and he clips this easily through midwicket for a couple
good length wide of off, he leaves again
angled down the leg side and he can't glance fine
length ball on off, and angling further across. Left alone
length ball outside off, and he uncomfortably punches off the back foot. But beats cover, and that allows him to take two. Harris considered taking a third, but eventually said 'no'
full and wide outside off, and he reaches forward to defend. But the delivery whizzes past his outside edge
length ball just outside off, from round the wicket. Punched with the bat's straight face to long off on this occasion
full and wide outside off, and he reaches forward to drive. Splices it back to Lakmal
full outside off again, and this time the cover drive takes an inside edge! But safely rolls away to the leg side to bring the over to a close
length ball just outside off, and he presses forward to defend with gentle hands. Played towards the leg side
length ball on off stump, and defended with the straight bat. Ball rolls away to mid off
length ball, just outside off stump, and left alone
back of a length on middle, and worked away off his pads to the vacant mid-wicket region. They pinch a single
length ball on off, and angling further away. He covers his off stump, and then shoulders his arms to safely negate this delivery
length ball on off stump, and he rocks back, using the depth of the crease to defend
length ball on off stump, and defended with soft hands off the back foot

second slip takes a screamer! Length ball just outside off, and the ball holds it's line despite angling inwards at first. That means Burns is playing in front of middle-stump, while the ball is on off-stump, and that's what gets the bat's outside edge. Mendis dives to his left and completes a sharp take
length ball, wide outside off, but angling inwards. Khawaja covers his off stump and then shoulders his arms
full on off, and he tries to drive straight. But it comes off the bat's inside half, and rolls back to mid on
beautiful shape from round the wicket. Length ball originating outside off but coming in sharply. Eventually well left by Khawaja, but the delivery was mighty close to the top of off stump
length ball, from round the wicket. And the in-seamer is left alone
between bat and body! Full just outside off, and enticing Harris to drive. He's played outside the ball's line this time and it sneaks between his bat and front leg
length ball on middle, and nudged off the back foot to the leg side with the straight bat
length ball, but the ball moves away this time. Harris shapes up to cut because of the loose nature of the delivery, but he's been beaten for place. Ball flies over the blade
back of a length on middle, that gets big on Harris. He tiptoes to ride the bounce, and then blocks to the leg side
back of a length on middle, and going over Harris' head as he ducks to this delivery
length ball, just outside off, and Khawaja has no intention of playing at it. Left alone, Dickwella collects
back of a length outside off, and Khawaja looks to fend off the back foot, but the ball gets big on him. Forced to defend without his eyes on the ball, and it hits the blade's shoulder
full and wide outside off, and left alone once again. Delivery was way too wide, and a slightly aggressive batsman would definitely have pounced onto that
full on off, and he crunches a drive past mid off's right! Chase for Lahiru Kumara, whose commitment ensures the ball doesn't get to the boundary
length ball, wide outside off, but seaming inwards wildly. Left alone by Harris, but Lakmal has overstepped
back of a length outside off, and he rides the bounce before blocking off the back foot
length ball, just outside off stump, and he shoulders his arms this time

just past his outside edge! Length ball angling in and Khawaja looked to defend off the back foot. But the delivery flies past his outside edge, and the batsman will feel lucky that didn't take a feather touch. So close
full and wide outside off. This ball's going straight through with the arm, and Khawaja has no trouble in deciding to let it go
length ball, just outside off stump, and left alone by Khawaja. Happy to do that all evening, it looks like

full and wide outside off, and Khawaja was tempted to drive. He takes a big stride and even swings his bat towards the ball, but pulls it back at the very last moment. He could've played it, in retrospect, given the bowler has bowled a front-foot no ball
length ball, wide outside off and once again he shoulders his arms to any delivery that's not aimed at his stumps
length ball on off, and angling further away from over the wicket. Happily lets it go to dickwella
length ball on off, and turning away after hitting the deck. Carefully fended off the back foot
length ball, wide outside off, and he rocks back to slash a cut. Played wide of point, and that's four easy runs for Harris
length ball on off, and worked off his pads to the leg side
full just outside off, flighting this delivery. Defended back to Perera off the front foot
full on middle, and nudged towards the leg side this time. Stopped by midwicket
length ball, wide outside off and turning away. Mistimes the cut to point on this occasion
good length just outside off, but the ball holds it's line. Khawaja keeps his bat in front of his body since it's so close to his stumps, but the ball goes past his blade anyway
back of a length on off, and he swivels to pull along the ground. Deep midwicket runs around the boundary to keep it down to only two
length ball on off, but the ball stays low this time. Khawaja rolls his wrists and whips this away off his pads to square leg
length ball, just outside off, and bunted towards cover off the back foot
length ball, just outside off stump, and left alone after he drags his bat towards the ball before pulling it back late
length ball, wide outside off, and he tries to pull his bat back. But it hits his blade anyway, and rolls away to deep point for a couple more
length ball on middle, and angling away from Harris. Bunted off the back foot to point
back of a length on middle, and he shapes up to flat-bat a pull. But the shot's been bottom-edged to mid on
nice shape from Kumara. Length ball on middle, and while Harris opts to shoulder his arms, the ball is very close to the top of off stump
length ball, aimed at the stumps, and nudged off his hips to the leg side. Straight to square leg though
length ball on middle, and defended with gentle hands off the back foot. Ball rolls away to mid off
back of a length on middle, and firmly punched past the non-striker's right. Mid off needs to race towards long-off, but Chandimal manages to drag it back
length ball, just outside off stump, and he misses the cut. Through to the keeper
length ball, just outside off stump, and defended back to the bowler off the back foot
length ball, wide outside off stump, and he looks to cut again! Misses once more
length ball, wide outside off stump, and he shoulders his arms this time
length ball on leg stump, and clipped off his pads to square leg. Sub fielder Sadeera slides across the ground to intercept
length ball, just outside off stump, and he lets the ball go into the keeper's gloves
length ball, just outside off, and blocked off the back foot to cover
length ball, wide outside off stump, and he bunts this away to point. Tried to get his bat out of the way, but eventually plays a checked shot
back of a length just outside off stump, and he rides the bounce to play a cut shot. Gently steered to point
full and wide outside off, and he slashes hard at this. Tries to lift a drive over cover, but the ball goes over point instead. Two men chase after it, but the ball wins the race in the end
full and wide outside off stump, and he presses forward towards the ball before eventually shouldering his arms
back of a length on off stump, and he gets under the ball's line and allows it to go to Dickwella
full on off, and bunted down the ground to mid off
full on off stump, and Khawaja is forced to play at it. Looks to defend, and the outside edge falls short of second slip
length ball on middle, and he tiptoes before nudging a shot into he gap on the leg side
length ball o off, and he steers this into the gap between gully and point. Three fielders - including the keeper - give the ball a chase
full and wide outside off, and left alone
length ball on leg stump, and clipped away to square leg. They can't pinch a single though
yorker that lands just before off stump, and Khawaja gets his toes out of the way before opening the bat's face fine. Runs this late past the slip cordon's left for four
full outside off stump, and he presses forward to defend. But the ball goes past his outside edge
length ball, wide outside off, and he shoulders his arms on this occasion. Dickwella collects from near his chest
length ball on middle, and the attempted pull goes over his head. Way too high, reckons umpire Erasmus
full and wide outside off, and he checks a drive to cover
length ball, just outside off stump, and he rides the bounce to block from near his face
length ball landing on middle stump, but angling across the batsman's body. Left alone once again
length ball, wide outside off, and he laps a cut-shot off the back foot. Played past the diving point fielder, and after that... it's got four written all over it
length ball on off stump, and he stays on the back foot to block this delivery
length ball, wide outside off, and punched off the back foot to cover
length ball on off, and angling inwards. Nudged off his pads to the leg side
full on off, and driven tentatively towards the leg side after stepping forward. Intercepted at midwicket
length ball, wide outside off stump, and blocked away to the leg side

fourth time he gets Khawaja! Chopped on, and Australia lose a second wicket just ten minutes before stumps. Not short enough for the cut, not wide enough for the cut, and the in-drifter is inside-edged right onto Khawaja's stumps. Delight for Sri Lanka
length ball on middle, and padded away to the leg side
full just on off stump, and blocked away to the leg side
tossed up on leg stump, and worked away to the leg side. Square leg intercepts
full outside leg stump, and padded away. Ball pitching outside leg anyway
full on off stump, and he takes a big stride forward to block
length ball, wide outside off, and he chooses not to play the cut shot
full outside off stump, and Harris presses forward before shouldering his arms. Through to Dickwella
length ball on middle and leg stump. Defended off the back foot to the bowler
length ball, wide outside off, and he allows the delivery to go through to the keeper
full just outside off, and blocked away to cover
full outside leg stump, and tapped away to midwicket
full on middle, and the front-foot defense is flayed over to cover
full on leg stump, and pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
dropped at short leg! Length ball, outside off and turning inwards. Lyon inside-edges this towards the leg side, but he fielder can't hold on! Roshen the fielder
full just outside off, and defended back to the bowler
no they can't. A length ball, wide outside off, and blocked away to cover off the back foot
good length angled across he fends and misses! Nothing shot just poking from the crease away from his body
good length, tighter to off, he defends with soft hands back down the pitch
141kph, fuller and wider of off, he pushes on the front foot to mid off
141kph, fuller outside off, he tries to drives and miscues off the thick inside half of the bat to mid on
glorious square drive through cover-point! 141kph, wide half-volley and Harris leans into a drive and it makes a beautiful crack off the bat! It races away

caught at point! Incredibly soft dismissal! Short and wide from Kumara, he just guides a cut shot, rather than hammering it, like catching practice it ballooned waist high to point and straight to the man, Thirimanne. Easy catch
beaten by a lovely 126kph, out-swinger, wide of off, he pushes at it and misses
129kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease to mid on
128kph, good length out-swinger on off, he pushes on the front foot to point
129kph, good length, well wide of off, he leaves on the front foot
128kph, fuller outside off, he check drives to the gap at cover-point and he's off the mark
131kph, good length out-swinger wide of off, he leaves this alone
full angled down, he tries to glance it comes off pad and runs fine between the keeper and leg slip for four leg byes!
145kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot off the inside edge and it squirts behind him to leg slip

hug LBW appeal Not out is the call. Sri Lanka review. Full toss angled into leg, hits him on the base of the back heel, it rolls behind square for a leg bye. No bat involved. Ball tracking has the impact outside leg and going way down leg side. Terrible review.
146kph, good length, angling in to off, just straightening, he makes a decisive leave
back of a length on off, he defends off the back foot into the on side
wide of the crease, 137kph, good length angled in to a fourth stump line, he plays a textbook forward defence
beaten by a superb out-swinger! Angled into off and shapes away late past the edge. Not many players would nick that
129kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends off the outside half of the bat to point
fuller outside off, he drives firmly to mid off

caught at second slip! Brilliant catch by Mendis diving forward! The umpires are checking if it carried but it did! Superb cricket. Good length, angling in and shaping away, he presses forward to defend, gets an outside edge with soft hands. It flies low to seocnd slip and Mendis reached forward and got his hands underneath it. Great catch. The third umpire double checked it but it was a clean catch and a really good one
127kph, bouncer, it really climbs, he ducked very late, it flies way over the keeper's head for four byes!
127kph, good length well wide of off, he leaves this alone
142kph, back of a length wide of off, he raises the bat above his head to let it pass
good length, nipping back, he's forward and leaving on length as it's tight to off but just over the top
141kph, bouncer, over off, he ducks under it early
139kph, back of a length over off, he raises the bat and lets this go on length as it flicks his chest on the way through
142kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending
hit on the pad, huge appeal for LBW, not out. It was fuller outside off, nipping back, it hit the front pad but just outside the line of off. Good decision. No review from Sri Lanka
127kph, good length wide of off, trying to swing back but he's able to leave this through to Dickwella
129kph, good length, outside off, tailing back, he leaves well again
129kph, good length tempter way wide of off, he leaves again
fuller length 130kph, but a fifth stump line and he shoulders arms again
129kph, fuller length, fifth stump line, he plays this time pushing firmly to mid off
128kph, fuller shaping in, he pushes with the angle on the front foot to mid on
141kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
142kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves on the front foot confidently
140kph, bouncer, it is very high and outside off, he ducks under it easily
136kph, back of a length wide of off, he leaves off the back foot through to Dickwella
140kph, good length fifth stump line, asking a question, but Labuschagne is happy to leave
143kph, fuller outside off, he strides forward and plays a solid forward defence
132kph, good length angled across, he leaves this alone through to the keeper
130kph, good length in the channel outside off, he strides out and lets it go again
129kph, good length slanting in but still wide, he's back and leaving once more
a hint of width and he late cuts past gully to find the boundary! The pressure is released. It was fractionally short and wide and he got in a great position and snaps the wrists on a late cut!
fuller length, tighter to off, 131kph, he defends from the crease to mid off
he pads up to a late inswinger, it's high, Sri Lanka appeal, but it's not out. Too high. Dangerous leave from Head
131kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
129kph, good length in the channel, sixth stump line, he leaves this alone again
135kph, fuller length closer to off, he presses forward to defend to mid off
angled down leg and he glances this easily behind square to a raucous cheer from the Queensland crowd

another appeal for LBW, hit outside the line, not out, it's rolled to slip who fires at the striker's and no one was backing up! Three overthrows! Everyone was looking at the umpire for the decision. Strange from Mendis to throw when Labuschagne had both feet in the crease
135kph, good length wide of off, he's happy to leave again
good length wide of off, he leaves alone again
beaten by a beauty! This wobbled in, hit the seam and nipped away, he pushed forward to defend and it zipped past the edge
132kph, good length, fifth stump line, he's forward and defending on the front foot
132kph, good length wide of off, he tries to leave but doesn't withdraw the bat late enough, it runs off the face on the bounce into the gully
131kph, good length on middle and leg, he clips this off the front foot to wide mid on
very full outside off, 130kph, he squeezes a forward defence to point
138kph, good length angled way wide of off, he is leaving watchfully again
137kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler

edged just high and wide of second slip! He flashed at a wide tempter, feet nowhere, got a thick edge that flew just out of reach of second slip and away to the fine third man rope! Head is furious with himself at that shot.
good length outside off, he wisely leaves this alone this time
shorter and wider, he chases a cut shot and misses again!
good length, angled across and he's able to leave this one
138kph, good length wide of off, he leaves easily wide of off
142kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves this alone once more
140kph, good length angled towards off, he presses forward and defends on the front foot
back of a length, angled into off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
short ball, wide of off, he tries to pull but checks the stroke to mid on
good length, 138kph, wide of off, he leaves again
full, and wide outside off stump. Head steps forward and then shoulders his arms
length ball angling in, and he prods forward to block back to Chameera
back of a length outside off, but angling into Head again. He rides the bounce to block towards the leg side. The umpire, however, has put out his right hand for a front-foot no-ball
length ball outside off, and holding it's line. Left alone by Head
length ball, on off stump, and angling further away. Head covers his offstump and shoulders his arms
back of a length on middle stump, and he tiptoes to nudge this away to the leg side. Soft hands on display
full on leg stump, but some swing takes the ball further down the leg side. Keeper fumbles too, and that allows Australia to pinch an extra run
back of a length on middle, and he rides the bounce to steer a square shot to point
length ball on leg stump, and that's been worked off his hips to square leg. They scamper across for one
length ball, just outside off but skidding inwards. Labuschagne covers his off stump, and then shoulders his arms
length ball aimed at Labuschagne's body, and he comfortably fends this off the back foot to mid on
full on leg stump, and clipped beautifully off his pads. Work for the fielder at deep backward square, but he manages to run around the boundary and intercept from near cow corner
length ball on middle, and he shuffles across to the off side, before nudging it to square leg off his hips
full outside leg stump, and steered fine to the fielder at fine leg for a walking single
full and wide outside off, and he jams his bat down to check-drive a shot through the covers! Races away to the square boundary
full and wide outside off, but too wide reckons Head. Doesn't bother chasing it, allowing it instead to find the keeper's gloves
length ball on off, and he walks across to the off side, before fending it away off the back foot
length ball on middle, and some extra bounce forces Head to tiptoe. Eventually comfortably blocked back to Chameera

full and wide outside off stump, and he slaps a cover drive past mid-off's right. Chase for the fielder, and he dives near the boundary... but did Chandimal make a mess of it near the boundary? He missed the first parry, and on his second attempt, it's his back leg that's touching the rope. Full marks for effort, fail marks for execution
length ball just outside off, and turning inwards. Defended off the back foot to Perera
full on off, and he takes a big stride forward to block towards short midwicket
length ball on middle, and nudged off his pads to square leg
tossed up just outside off, and he crunches a drive past Perera's left. Chase for mid off, who manages to pull the ball back well short of the boundary rope
full on off, and Head gets to the pitch of the ball, before blocking with soft hands
full, but wide outside off. Spinning away from Head, and he uses the bat to guide a soft shot towards the off side. Drinks
length ball, just wide outside off, and he opts to shoulder his arms
full just outside off, and he takes a big stride forward to block with the straight bat. Ball rolls away to mid off
full on middle, and tapped off his toes to short midwicket. Gently played, and the ball dribbles into the fielder's hands
length ball, wide outside off, and he shoulders his arms
full just outside off, and he check-drives to cover for a quick single
back of a length on leg stump, and that sends Head ducking, but the umpire thinks it was way too short. Calls it a wide
length ball on middle stump, and whipped away - off his hips - to deep backward square
full on middle, but drifting down leg. Head manages to get a feather-touch to this, and the ball rolls away to short fine leg
length ball on leg stump, and nudged away to square leg
full on leg stump, and Labuschagne takes a big stride forward to fend towards the leg side
length ball on leg stump, and whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket. Man there
full on off, and he gets inside the ball's line, before driving through the on-side to midwicket
length ball on middle, and he backs away to make some room, before punching past the bowler's left. Mid-off gives it a chase
length ball, just wide outside off, and flying over off stump as Labuschagne shoulders his arms

big appeal for lbw, but not given! Length ball on off stump that stays low and Labuschagne shoulders his arms expecting the ball to go past his pads, but the ball comes in and hits his front pad. Always dangerous with no shot offered, but it's the extra bounce that saves him
full on off, and he opts to use his bat this time. Defended back to Kumara
length ball, wide outside off stump, and left alone by Marnus
full, just outside off stump, and pushed away to cover with soft hands. They choose not to run
full just outside off stump, and he drives through the ball's line, past Kumara's left. But stopped by mid off
half-tracker outside off stump, and Head prods forward before rocking back. Slaps it through the covers thereafter, and the fielder in the deep must run around the boundary
full on off, and he shuffles across the stumps, before paddling an effective sweep to fine leg
length ball on off, and turning inwards. Looks to punch, but inside-edged right onto his body
full on middle, and that's been swept hard behind squrare! No stopping that. First 50 partnership of the Test
full just outside off stump, and worked off his toes to midwicket
full on leg stump, and he taps it to midwicket's right for a quick single. Double-digit over!
back of a length just outside off, forcing Marnus to duck swiftly under the line of the ball
full just outside off stump, and he presses forward to block with the bat's straight face
length ball, wide outside off stump, and cut square to the fielder at point. Stopped by Roshen
length ball, just outside off stump, and he defends off the back foot. Ball takes the outside edge and rolls down to third man for one
length ball on middle, and he tiptoes to defend off the back foot. Soft hands ensure the ball falls near his toes
length ball outside off, and moving slightly away too. Head sticks his bat out and manages to steer a fine shot to third man, past gully
full just outside off, and tapped away from his body to cover for a single
full on middle, and he shovels a straight drive down to long on for one
length ball just outside off, and he presses forward to block to the bowler
full outside off, and he skips down the wicket to drive. Mistimed to cover
full just outside off, and he takes a big stride forward to defend
full on middle, and he covers his off stump, before defending to mid on. But Lakmal's overstepped again. The fourth of the Test for Sri Lanka
length ball just outside off stump, and Marnus covers his off stump before shouldering his arms. Some late movement into the batsman as it whizzes over the top of off stump
full outside off, and jagging away from Marnus this time. He gets to the pitch of the ball, before opting to let it go
full on off, and he drives through the leg side. Kumara - at midwicket - gives the ball a chase, and manages to pull it back
full on middle, and the clip off his pads past midwicket gives Australia the lead!
full just outside off, and he taps to cover with soft hands for a quick single.
length ball outside off, but too close to his body for the cut. Spliced to point
off break outside off, 84kph, he presses forward and defends back to the bowler
full on middle, he drives firmly back to the bowler
tossed up, he skips out and drives nicely straight of mid off, Lakmal makes a diving stop but they run one as it bounces off his hand towards mid on
fuller on off, he pushes slowly back to the bowler
drifting down leg, he paddle sweeps fine of short fine leg with control, they get a couple
looped up on off, 81kph, he skips down to the pitch and defends
off break, on leg, he is taken on the pad and it rolls away
shorter on leg, he's back and tucking this past short leg for a single
beaten! 83kph, outside off, a hint of turn away, he prods at it and misses on the front foot
shorter length, he is back and punching back to the bowler
pushed through, 84kph, on off, he's back and defending
93kph, fired fast wide of off, he leaves this alone
shorter wide of off, he's back and cutting straight to backward point
he sweeps firmly past short fine and away to the rope! This was full on leg, he hammers this firmly behind square and past the man defending one and he gets a boundary
shorter length, he's back and punching neatly through cover, good stroke to pick up two more
shorter on leg, he turns this past leg slip and short fine is deeper now so they pinch a single
quicker and flatter on off, 83kph, he defends from the crease with firm hands
tossed up and turning away, he leaves this alone outside off
127kph, good length and a lot of swing, it shapes well wide of off and is left alone
129kph, full and swinging away, he leans out and plays a quality cover drive placing this past cover, it doesn't go all the way as the outfield is a touch slow

dropped by Dickwella! Superb delivery not rewarded! Good length, angling in and seaming away a touch, he is squared up defending, gets a healthy edge, Dickwella dives late and full stretch to his left and drops it with the one hand!
good length wide of off he leaves
back of a length wide of off, he leaves this alone again
good length wide of off, he shoulders arms
tossed up, 85kph, on off, he defends on the front foot
84kph, good length, on off, he stretches out to defend
fuller and pushed through outside off, he is striding out to defend
drifting into off, he goes back to a fuller length to defend
shorter length, wide of off, he cuts firmly straight to cover-point
fuller on off, he pushes firmly back to the bowler
good length, wide of off, he is happy to leave
132kph, fuller out-swinger, he is leaving on the front foot this time
132kph, fuller out-swinger again, nice shape but too wide and he leaves once more
133kph, fuller on middle and leg, no swing, he pushes neatly wide of mid on and goes with the stroke for a single
back of a length, angled into off, he defends from the crease
129kph, fuller and hinting to shape in, he pushes off the thick inside half of the bat to square leg
shorter outside off, he's back decisively and giving room to punch very well through the gap at cover for another three
84kph, good length and a bit of turn on off, he's back and defending to short leg
advances to the pitch and drives nicely straight of mid on, well timed, long chase for Lakmal and he just hauls it in
shorter on the hip, he pulls easily past leg slip to the man at deep backward square
shorter outside off, he cuts hard to backward point and Chameera makes an outstanding diving save to prevent runs
tossed up, he skips out and defends with bat and pad together. There's an ambitious appeal for LBW that doesn't warrant any acknowledgement from the umpire
good length wide of off, he's not interesting in playing and lets it go
good length angled into leg stump, he clips this easily on the front foot to the gap at midwicket for a single
good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
cracking drive punched straight of mid off! The man was quite wide. It was over-pitched and he just punched this through the line and timed it beautifully to beat the diving Chameera
back of a length on off, he's back and defending towards midwicket
good length, fourth stump line, he shuffles back and across and defends, dead batting it into the off side
full pitching outside leg, he sweeps easily to deep backward square
shorter outside off, he's back and punching firmly to cover
tossed up, 84kph, he skips out and defends back to the bowler
fuller, drifting in, he reaches out and defends on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and punching to mid off who is quite deep and they get a quick single without much risk
full outside leg stump again, he sweeps finer this time and they get two as the man comes around
angled in towards off, he gets a little inside edge onto the inside thigh
131kph, good length fifth stump line, he defends off the back foot to mid off
short and wide and he places a cut shot behind point! Well controlled and placed it perfectly! 100 partnership up for these two
fuller outside off, he drives firmly back to the bowler

fuller outside off, he flicks the hands through a square drive on the front foot and picks th gap forward of point! It goes all the way to the rope, Kumara never gives up and the chase but he might be touching the rope with his leg as he pulled it back. No. He's done well. Another three
good length outside off, he tries to drive on the up but mistimes to mid off
fuller on middle, he turns this against the spin on the front foot to the gap at midwicket
shorter on off, he backs away and cuts firmly through cover-point and times this well enough to reach the rope! A maiden Test 50 for Labuschagne. Warm applause from his home crowd
off break darted into leg, he tries to sweep, is hit on the pad but it's sliding down
tossed up outside off, he pushes firmly back to the bowler
he sweeps this from off middle, plays it well to the man at deep backward square
tossed up on off, he skips down and pushes back to the bowler
back of a length, 136kph on off, he defends standing tall on the crease line
136kph, good length on the top of off, he defends on the front foot to mid on
wide of the crease, angled into middle and off, he clips this to midwicket
137kph, short ball outside off, he mistimes it in the air but it lands well short of the man in the deep. Wasn't in total control there
back of a length, 136kph, outside off, he punches off the back foot wide of mid off
137kph, bouncer, he sways under it easily
tossed up, on off, he reaches out and defends to short leg
shorter length on off, he stands up and defends on the back foot
quicker and some turn, Head jabs at it and gets a thick edge that runs to backward point
tossed up wider and slower, he leaves this alone
85kph, good length on off, he's back and punching back to the bowler
he skips down to a fuller ball and gets an inside edge onto pad
good length wide of off, he pushes off the back foot to point
back of a length, wide of off, it rears from a length and beats the outside edge as he is squared up!
132kph, back of a length on off, he defends from the back foot
135kph, bouncer, outside off, he sways under it very easily
136kph, good length, hint of seam away, he gets a thick outside edge poking forward that flies to point
back of a length on middle and off, he turns this to square leg
full just outside off stump, and defended
full outside off, and turning away. He looks to drive, but mistimes to mid off
full on off, but he skips down the wicket to convert it into a full toss. Splices a shot to mid off again
length ball, teasing outside off, and Head allows it to go into the keeper's gloves
full just outside off, and driven down the ground to mid-on this time
third maiden in a row! Length ball on off, and he punches uncomfortably to mid-on
length ball on middle, and going down leg. Manages to get a feather-touch off his body as the ball dribbles down to fine leg
length ball on middle, and worked off his pads - off the back foot - to midwicket. Finds the fielder
length ball on middle, and he allows the ball to get to him, before defending from under his nose. Ball rolls back to Chameera
length ball on middle, and he bunts a back-foot punch to cover for a quick single. Moves on to 48
back of a length, slower ball on off stump. He allows the ball to get to him, before nudging it to the leg side with soft hands for a quick single
length ball on off, and clipped off his pads to the vacant midwicket region. Head on 49
length ball outside off, but snaking inwards. Head backs away, and mistimes a muscled shot to cover
full just outside of, and he skips down the ground to drive straight. Excellent effort from the bowler - diving to his right - to stop a certain single (or more)
full just outside off, and he reaches forward to block towards the off side
length ball, wide outside off, and sliced off the back foot to cover. Misfield from the fielder, and that's fifty for Travis Head!
overpitched on middle, and he shovels a mistimed drive to mid-off
full on middle, and worked off his pads to the vacant region near deep midwicket
length ball on middle, but going down leg. Labuschagne tries to paddle this fine, and misses. But so does Dickwella
full outside off, and he exposes all three stumps by shuffling across the wicket, before paddling a sweep fine down the leg side
full just outside off stump, and the attempted nudge towards the leg side is bat-padded towards short leg instead
full on off, and the skidder is check-punched down the ground to mid-on
full just outside off, and confidently driven straight past the bowler's right to long on. They walk across for one
full, wide outside off, and he takes a big stride forward to fend it away to cover
tossed up on leg stump, and that's an inside-out cover drive that pierces the off-side field. Slides through cover and mid-off, and collects a couple more for his team
full just outside off, but he walks down the ground to pad this away to cover
full outside off stump, and he throws his hands at this. Smashes a shot straight past the bowler's left, and mid-on must give the ball a mighty chase
length ball outside leg stump, and angling into his hips. Nudged gently off the front foot to the leg side
tossed up outside leg stump, and easily paddled fine to Chameera manning the backward-square boundary
length ball outside off, and turning further away. Head backs away to cut, but finds the fielder at cover point
full, outside off, and no real turn. Comfortably blocked off the front foot
full on off, and he drives with the offbreak. Beats the bowler, past his right, and goes down to mid-on for one
full on middle, and he wedges a front-foot drive back to the bowler. Too low on the bat, no power off that shot
full outside off, and he wedges another cover drive. But the ball goes through the fielder's legs and that allows Head to rotate the strike. Bad bounce just before the ball reached Chandimal there
full outside off, and turning inwards. Driven through mid-on for a single
full just outside off stump, and he takes a big stride forward to defend
full on leg stump, and tapped with soft hands to the leg side for a quick single
full on off, and he walks down the ground, before defending back to Dananjaya
full just outside off, and he reaches forward to defend
length ball on middle, and extra bounce gets big on Head. But he backs away to make some room, and then absolutely flat-bats a pull through deep midwicket
full on middle, but he's skipped down the ground to meet it. Bat-padded before scampering back into the crease
length ball on middle, but coming into Head. No room to work with, and he mistimes a straight-batted punch to the bowler
length ball just outside off, and turning into Labuschagne. Punched off the back foot to mid on
full just outside off, and worked with the spin - off his pads - to midwicket. Nice call early for a single
length ball, from round the wicket, and turning away from Head. Makes room to cut, but slaps it straight to point
full outside off, and he skips down the ground to punch a drive. Finds cover
full, tossed up outside off, and Head reaches the ball with a big stride to defend
full on off, and he drives inside the ball's line. Wedged back to the bowler though. Another drinks break
quicker ball first up after the drinks break. Length ball outside off, and skidding right into Dickwella's gloves
length ball, wide outside off, and he splices a cut to point
length ball just outside off, and he stays on the back foot to defend
almost a medium-pacer's delivery there. Full just outside off, and defended towards the leg side
length ball, just wide outside off, and he steers a cut-shot past the fielder at point. Enough time to jog back for the second
length ball, wide outside off stump again. Rides the bounce to punch through to cover
short outside off, and turning further away. Head looks to put it away, but the cut is intercepted at cover
full on middle, and he comes down the ground to drill a drive. Straight to mid-on though
full on middle, and clipped off his toes to the leg side. Midwicket cleans up
full outside off, and he skips down the ground to crunch another cover drive. Chandimal dives to his left to stop
full outside off again, and once more driven through the off side. Chandimal stops it once again

full and wide outside off, and Head comes down the wicket to drive. But he sees the quicker ball, and tries to pad it away, but all he can do is bat-pad it towards the off side. He's lucky that the ball didn't go straight into silly mid-off's hands
length ball on middle, and not allowing Head to free his arms. Punched back to Karunaratne
full just outside off stump, and he meets the ball on the front foot to drive. Played to mid-on
length ball on leg stump, and clipped fine off his pads! Chameera looks to cut it off at fine leg, but he fluffs it in the end. Ball rolls into the rope despite the fielder getting a hand to it
length ball on middle, and angling away from Head. Punched off the back foot to mid-off
beats point! Length ball on off, and with the ball moving away... it allows Head to free his arms. Slapped behind square for four more
length ball on off, but too close to his body for the cut. Mistimed towards the off side
length ball on middle, and worked off the back foot to the vacant square-leg region. Single brings up their 150-run stand
