full on off, and he drills it to Sadeera - the 12th man - to mid off. Misfield, however, allows them to take the single
length ball, wide outside off, but turning inwards. Nudged away to the leg side

big appeal for lbw but not given! Perera goes full on off, but is it turning in too much? Sri Lanka review anyway. The ball lands on off, and hist his front pad on middle and leg. Two questions remain: 1) whether it's too high, or 2) whether it's missing leg stump... and yes, it's both high and wide. Sri Lanka lose their last review
length ball, just wide outside off stump, and he steers a back-foot punch to the vacant point region
length ball, wide outside off, and cut off the back foot to point once more
length ball on off, and seaming away after hitting the deck. Marnus looks to defend, but he's surprised by the ball's movement. Goes through to the keeper
full on off, and he meets the ball on the front foot for a drive. Played to mid on
big appeal for lbw again! But umpire Erasmus says no. Full on off, and angling into his pads, but Labuschagne had inside-edged the attemptee drive onto his pads
width offered, and cut to deep point
length ball, just outside off, and cut off the back foot to deep point
length ball, wide enough for Marnus to cut square. Slapped to deep extra cover for two more
length ball, wide outside off, and he allows the ball to go through to the keeper
full on middle, and he walks down the ground, before nudging it past midwicket for a couple more
full just outside off, and the attempted defensive shot takes an inside edge towards leg slip! Could've easily played on there
full just outside off, and driven away from his body, with the bat's open face to cover point
width offered outside off, and he makes room to cut. Finds point though
full on off, and he walks down the wicket to defend back to silly mid-off
low full toss on off stump, and he carefully drives this straight past the bowler's right to wide long on
length ball just outside off. Turning into the left-hander, but he manages to muscle a punch down to long off
back of a length on middle, and the bounce gets big on Labuschagne. But carefully negated to the leg side... choosing to flick with soft hands to keep the ball along the ground
length ball on leg, and going across the right hander. Marnus backs away, rocks deep into his crease, and crunches a cut in front of square through cover. They run four!
full on middle, and he drives with the bat's open face to cover
length ball on middle, and skidding through. Clipped to midwicket
full on leg stump, and swept to fine leg for a walking single
length ball on off, and turning into his body. Defended

Dickwella appeals for caught behind but umpire says 'no'! Sri Lanka don't have any reviews either. Was a length ball outside off that Head tried to steer late down third man. He missed, and Dickwella ensured he appealed with all his heart. No mark on the hotspot either, replays suggest
length ball just outside off, and cut to cover
full on middle, and he skips down the ground for a leg-side whip. Hit well, but finds the fielder at midwicket

caught at short mid on! Full on off, and Marnus skips down the wicket to lift a drive over the lurking fielder. But it's come off the bat's bottom-half, and the fielder under the helmet - Thirimanne - jumps to his right to take a solid catch. Labuschagne falls after scoring Australia's highest Test score this summer
full just outside off, and the tall man takes a big stride forward to defend
full on middle, and angling into his pads. Patterson walks inside the ball's line, and defends towards the leg side
full and wide outside off, hoping the batsman would take the bait. Patterson chooses to shoulder his arms instead
full on middle, and he shovels a drive back to Dananjaya
full outside off, and false shot from Patterson. Tries to drive through cover, but it comes off the bat's inside half. Ball rolls away to the leg side
length ball on the fourth-stump line, but angling into Head. Punched off the back foot to cover
tossed up, full outside off stump. Defended with soft hands
full on off, and the ball skids through. Defended off the back foot this time
full on off, and he skips down the ground to drive. Hit straight back to Perera
full just outside off stump, and defended off the front foot. Maiden
length ball outside off, and left alone by the left-handed Patterson
length ball on middle, and Patterson rides the bounce before firmly defending off the back foot
full on leg stump, and he gently nudges this fine down the leg side. The crowd roars as they think Pattinson's scored his first Test runs... but alas, it's leg byes!
full and wide outside off, but a big boomerang swing right into Head. He shoulders his arms, and he's lucky that the ball didn't clip off stump
length ball outside off, and coming in sharply. Head pulls his bat back, and allows the delivery to go over the stumps and into Dickwella's gloves
full on middle, and driven with the inswing to the leg side. Time for dinner!
84kph, pushed through skidding on, he's back and defending
82kph, slower, shorter a bit of spin, he's back and defending
beaten by a slower off break that lured him forward and rips past the outside edge!
84kph, drifting in, wide of off, he leaves and it skids straight on but it was wide of off
fuller on off, he's forward defending with uncertainty, inside edge onto pad and it drops down
he skips down and drives against the turn to mid on and goes with the stroke to get off the mark in Test cricket
131kph, good length, angled across wide of off, he leaves alone
129kph, fuller and shaping back into the left-hander, he defends firmly with the full face back to the bowler

he clips this in air off the hip but forward of square leg, well timed and they get three as it runs towards the rope. It was a gift on the hip but he did square leg a look at it by hitting it in the air
shorter length on leg, he defends to midwicket
back of a length, shaping into off, 128kph, he stands tall on the back foot and defends
good length, 128kph, hint of shape in, but it's wide of off and he leaves watching it go past
back of a length on off, shaping back in, he is defending off the back foot back to the bowler
shorter on the hip, he clips this easily to square leg
126kph, back of a length outside off, he punches beautifully off the back foot through cover, Head runs well to call Patterson back for three
shorter length, 128kph, swinging well down the leg side
back of a length on off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
good length wide of off, shaping back but not far enough to tempt Head to play
128kph, swinging into leg stumps, he tucks this off the pads wide of mid on
125kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to the gap at cover for a single
131kph, good length swinging into off, he defends half-forward on the front foot
flash and miss at a 127kph, back of a length ball that angles away from the left hander. He tried to back foot drive it square
good length, 129kph, wide of off and he wisely leaves this alone
127kph, good length but swinging down the leg side, he misses out on the leg glance here
shorter outside off, he punches this off the back foot powerfully through cover-point for yet another three
back of a length, nipping back in and catches him on the back thigh
back of a length outside off, he's back and defending into the off side
126kph, good length on off, he defends half forward from the crease
good length, fourth stump line, he leaves this on line and length
131kph, good length on off, he is squared up defending to cover
pushed through on off, 82kph, he's back and working to midwicket
floated up outside off, 82kph, he reaches out and defends without conviction
drifting into leg, he is back and working this to the gap at square leg
83kph, drifting into leg, he defends on the front foot past short leg
tossed up high outside off, he drives elegantly but can't beat cover
drifting into leg, he's back and working this behind square but straight to the fielder
130kph, shorter and wider, he cuts firmly straight to point
131kph good length shaping into off, he defends on the front foot to point
132kph, good length, swinging into the thigh pad, he misses out on a scoring chance
130kph, fuller swinging into off, he clips this with the swing to mid on
another one swinging way down leg, Dickwella has to dive to knock it down
glorious back foot drive through cover-point! There was width offered and he whipped the hands through it, and picked the gap at cover-point and it raced away
skips down the track and works this wide of mid on for one
advances to the pitch and drives firmly to mid on
85kph, tossed up wide of off, he leaves this alone
looped up outside off, he skips out and drives to cover
slower and higher on off, he reaches out and defends on the front foot
shorter and wider, he cuts firmly through point and picks up three more
131kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot back down the track
129kph, shorter on the thigh guard, he can't tuck this off the thigh, it runs away for a leg bye
128kph, back of a length outside off, he pushes off the back foot slowly to deep point and the man in the deep is slow to come in, Head calls Patterson back for an easy two
130kph, shorter outside off, he pulls but straight to mid on

Given LBW! Head reviews immediately. It was full and shaping back down the line of middle, he shuffled across the crease and tried to whip through the leg side. No bat involved. It hit him plumb infront of middle and was hitting the top of middle! Head thought height was an issue. Ball tracking said 'umpire's call'. Australia keep the review. But Head goes.

caught at second slip! Brilliant bowling! Incredible catching from Mendis! He's on a hat-trick! This was a cracker from Lakmal. Good length, angled in, swinging away late, Paine fended at it as it bounced away, squared up completely, it went low to Mendis and he dove forward again and snaffled it just above the turf getting his hands under it! Amazing catch.
drifting into off, 84kph, he reaches forward and defends on the front foot
pushed through of off, he defends from the crease
84kph, drifting in and sliding on, he's back and jamming the bat down
84kph, fired into off, he is back staying leg side and defending into the off side
he skips down and whips to midwicket
slower on off, 82kph, he reaches away from the body and defends
short and way wide of off! Too wide and he leaves this alone easily
beaten! Squared up by a beauty! This was angled in and shaping a way a touch back of a length. He was beaten all ends up
flash and miss on the drive! They appeal for caught behind but it's not out. He hit his back pad
132kph, full out-swinger wide of off, he leaves this easily
good length out-swinger, tempter wide of off, he leaves this alone
132kph, angled into off stump, no swing, he defends on the front foot
good length, it spins and he's squared up, it runs off the outside edge towards point
he skips down, doesn't get to the pitch, gets a thick inside edge just past short leg and gets a single
good length on off, not much turn, he defends from the crease
shorter off break, he defends off the back foot towards mid on
fuller and spinning in, he gets a thick inside edge just short of the man at bat pad on the on side
very full, half-volley, he gently pushes this to cover
130kph, back of a length shaping into off, he defends off the back foot
good length, 124kph, on middle, he defends from the crease
126kph, very full, pushed across the left-hander and he leaves
good length on odd, he defends to the gap at cover and they take a single
129kph, good length out-swinger, he is happy to leave this alone
beaten by a lovely out-swinger. Good length shaping away and he defends down the wrong line and misses
he skips down and tries to whip against sharp turn, lucky it hit the back pad and bounced away
good length on middle, he defends from the crease
advances again and whips against the turn to midwicket
tossed up, he drives firmly to cover
fuller on middle and leg, he defends solidly on the front foot
sharp spinning off break, wide of off, he shapes to cut but it spins too wide
length ball just outside off, but nipping back. Hits him above the knee roll, so ball's definitely too high
length ball, just wide outside off. Jagging further away after hitting the deck, and Cummins leaves it alone
length ball outside off, and seaming away thereafter. Cummins is happy to let it go for his 15th dot ball
full just outside off, and moving away once more. Cummins gets to the pitch of the ball, but then lets it go
full just outside off again, and the out-seamer is left alone by Cummins
full just outside off, and he lets it go to the keeper once again. Safe batting under the lights from Australia's *cough cough* number 9
length ball, wide outside off, and he stands tall to slap a cut to point
full on leg stump, and he goes down on one knee to slog-sweep. Hits his back leg, and rolls away to short fine-leg instead

sharp turn! Length ball on middle, and spinning down leg. Cummins gets his hips out of the ball's way and Dickwella can't hold on to it either. Takes a run to get off strike, but still not off his bat
full just outside off stump, and confidently blocked away to the off side
full outside off stump once again. Big stride from the tall man, before blocking towards short cover
full on middle, and he whips a shot away to midwicket. Not well-timed, but played into the gap
length ball, wide outside off but angling in from round the wicket. Left alone
length ball, on off stump, and punched off the back foot to cover
pushed off his hips to midwicket for a quick single
length ball, just wide outside off, and Cummins goes for a back-foot drive through the covers. Too late into the shot, the ball beating him even before his bat-swing

what a beauty! Cummins out for a duck. Length ball on off stump, and the ball just about moves away after hitting the pitch. Cummins tries to block towards mid-on, but the ball takes his outside edge and finds Dickwella's gloves. Completely squared him up there
crunched! Full outside off, and Starc shows no half-measures. Clears his front leg, and clatters a drive through the covers
length ball, wide outside off, and he makes room before playing a delicate cut-shot through the infield. Chase for the man from cover
length ball outside off, but angling in with the arm. Patterson walks down the wicket before padding it away to the off side
length ball, just outside off, and steered off the back foot to point
full on middle stump, and driven right back to the bowler
length ball, just outside off, and punched off the back foot to Karunaratne at deep extra cover
length ball on middle, and nudged off his pads to the vacant midwicket region. Fielder from square leg runs in to intercept, but enough time for Patterson to come back for the second
length ball on off, and he rides the bounce to muscle a pull behind square! No protection there, and the ball runs away to the boundary
length ball, wide outside off, and slapped through to the extra-cover boundary! Using the width brilliantly, and letting his bat do the talking
full ball just outside off, and he punches down the ground to mid-off. Intercepted inside the circle
length ball angling in from round the wicket, and tapped away - off his hips - to the leg side for a jogging single
back of a length on off, and the short ball is uncomfortably defended form near his face. Ball hits the side of his bat and rolls away to the leg side for a quick single
length ball, wide outside off, and slapped off the back foot to cover point
length ball, wide outside off, and he hammers a boundary through the covers once more! Shot, staying on the back foot and allowing his fast hands do all the damage
length ball, just outside off, and defended off the back foot
full on off, and defended back towards the non-striker off the front foot
quicker ball, full on middle and angled into his pads. Clipped to square leg off the back foot
length ball on off stump, and punched off the back foot to mid off
full on leg stump. Starc says on the back foot, and smothers the turn with a punch towards mid-on
length ball on middle, angling into his body. Worked off his hips to the fielder at square leg
length ball, just outside off, and fended away off the back foot towards the leg side
full on off stump, and the ball angles further away. Patterson shoulders his arms, after covering his stumps
length ball, just outside off, and angling further away. Left alone
full just outside off stump, and driven through the off side to mid off
length ball on middle, and he prods forward to defend off the front foot
full on off, and he happily lets the ball go into Dickwella's gloves
full on off stump, and he takes a big stride forward to defend
full just outside off stump again, and blocked away towards cover
full outside off, but turning away on this occasion. Fended off the back foot with the bat's open face... to point
full on leg stump, and nudged away past the lurking short-leg fielder
full just outside off, and forces Starc to come forward to defend. Ball sneaks just past his outside edge, and Dickwella whips the bails off. Out? Nah
tossed up outside off, and Starc leans forward to crunch a straight drive. Mistimed back to the bowler
length ball, just outside off, and he shoulders his arms to let the ball go to the keeper
length ball on off, and he tries to muscle a shot towards the leg side. Spliced to the leg side
length ball on middle, and the front-foot defense takes an inside edge! Goes through his legs to square leg

lbw appeal, and the finger has gone up! Late seam movement does Patterson in. Full on middle, but jagging into Patterson's pads, he tries to drive towards mid-on, but misses, and the umpire raises his finger. Patterson reviews, though, given he's the last recognised batsman... but he's still gone. Crashing into leg stump. A positive debut innings comes to an end
length ball on middle, but going down leg as Richardson misses the flick first ball
full outside off, and he tentatively pushes away from his body. Ball rolls away to cover
appeal for lbw, but not given. Length ball on middle that skids through, but Starc had inside-edged that onto his pad
juicy, tossed up ball, and Starc takes a wild leg-side slog. Smacked over square leg, and that's four more
full on leg stump again, and Starc slog sweeps over the fielder in the deep this time! Proper swing of the bat, no half-measures, and that's gone for another boundary
tossed up, almost a yorker, and wedged back to the bowler
full outside off, and another wild heave from Starc. Down on one knee, but misses completely
another full ball, shoveled back straight, but the ball hits the non-striker's bat. Starc says no to the single, probably because of the contact off Richardson's bat. Sporting
length ball on middle, and going down leg. But Richardson tries to work it towards the leg side, and the ball hits his hip
full outside off stump, and he tries to drive away from his body. Misses
full on middle, and the attemped drive towards mid-on takes a leading edge to the off side instead. But Richardson gets his first Test runs in the process
length ball on middle, and punched off the back foot to mid-on
smashed over long on! Full on middle, and he clears his front let to hammer a straight drive over the boundary. Boom! Crowd goes ballistic as a spectator takes an excellent catch in the stands
clipped! Full on off, but Starc shuffles across the line before timing a sweet shot through the midwicket region
length ball, just outside off stump. He walks down the ground to fend towards the off side

length ball, wide outside off, but Richardson skips down the wicket to lift a shot over mid-on. Unfortunately, for him, it's taken a leading edge to the off side... and cover takes an easy catch. Australia lead by 179
full on leg stump, and clipped fine! Paine jumps to his right, but the ball was simply too wide from him. Replays suggest it came off his hip
length ball going down leg, and Paine skips across the ground to intercept
length ball on off, and worked off his body to the leg side for a quick single
full, but very very wide outside off stump. Thirimanne has no interest in playing at that
back of a length on off, and he rides the bounce to block firmly
overpitched just outside off, and Thirimanne comes forward for the drive. Delivery swings slightly away, and goes past his outside edge
full on middle stump from the debutant. Defended towards the leg side first up
length ball, just outside off, and left alone by Karunaratne
length ball on off, and angling further in. Karunaratne shoulders his arms, but the ball clips the top of his pad! Lucky for him, ball was way too high for an lbw
length ball on off, and skidding inwards. Worked away to the leg side
length ball on off stump, and nudged off his pads to square leg once again. Played with the closed face of the bat
full and wide outside off, and he shoulders his arms this time. Sees the over out
length ball on middle, and going down the leg side. Happily left alone
full just outside off, and he drives away from his body to mid-off. Intercepted by the fielder on the off side
full on leg stump, but swinging further down the leg side. Paine has no chance either... and that's four byes for Sri Lanka!
back of a length on middle, and the ball hits his gut. Delivery stays low, and that should've hurt
length ball on off stump, and he lets the ball come to him, before smothering a shot to the leg side
full on off stump, and he taps this away to the leg side for a quick single
length ball, just wide outside off but coming inwards. Left alone by the batsman
back of a length on middle, and the ball comes inwards. Nudged off his pads to the leg side
full on middle, and swinging inwards. Firmly defended with the bat's straight face
full on off stump, and he takes a tiny step forward to defend straight back to the bowler
full on middle, and the front-foot defense takes an inside edge down to backward square leg for a walking single
length ball just outside off, and tapped away to the off side for a quick single
length ball just outside off, and tapped off the back foot to cover
length ball, wide outside off, and spinning further away. Slapped through point for a single

edged, but just wide of first slip! Teasing delivery on off stump, and he comes forward to defend. But the ball turns away oh-so-slightly, and takes the outside edge. Ball was dipping quickly, but Khawaja was late to bend forward
full just outside off, and he takes a big stride forward to defend
full just outside off, and turning away from the batsman. Left alone
back of a length outside off, and turning further away. Left alone
round the wicket, length ball outside off, and angling in. Defended off the back foot to the leg side
full outside off, and swinging away from Dimuth. Ball goes through to the keeper
full outside off, and the ball swings away again. Left alone once more
length ball on off, but jagging away from the left-handed batsman. Fended off the back foot to the off side
full outside off, and swinging inwards. Tries to drive towards mid-off, but inside-edge takes it to the leg side instead

And yes they can! Had a weird feeling about this one, and Cummins - the hero from the first innings - strikes off the day's last ball. Length ball, just outside off, and Karunaratne tries to fend it tentatively. The outswinger takes the outside edge, and there's no way Tim Paine was dropping that. Stumps on day two with Sri Lanka trailing by 162 runs.
130kph, full outside off, a bit of shape back in but wide enough to leave
137kph, good length pushed across the left-hander, not much shape on this, he leaves
good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot slicing this along the ground to the gully
135kph, good length, shaping back into off, he defends on the front foot
138kph, bouncer, over leg stump, he ducks underneath it
139kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
135kph, shorter length wide of off, shaping away, he prods and then withdraws the bat inside the line late

caught in the gully! What a brute of a ball! 138kph, good length, it climbed steeply off a length and left him, he pressed forward to defend, it comes off the shoulder off the bat and balloons to gully and Patterson jumps up and takes the catch very well above his head!
140kph, inswinger angled down the leg side, he tries to glance but misses
140kph, good length, he's squared up as hit hits him on the thigh pad and dropped down
139kph, back of a length, angled in and straightening, he's squared up again defending on the back foot
142kph, good length on middle and off, he is squared u-p again defending on the front foot off balance
136kph, fuller length outside off, he pushes wide of mid off for a single
136kph, good length angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot
137kph, good length angled into leg stump, he tucks this neatly behind square for a single
139kph, good length, fourth stump line, hint of shape in, he defends on the front foot back towards mid off
135kph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it
136kph, full outside off, he presses forward and defends to mid off

caught at second slip! He plays a booming drive to a fuller out-swinger, front foot didn't get a long way forward, it wasn't a half-volley but tempting enough, he loses his shape launching into this drive, gets a thick edge, it flies head high to Burns at second slip and he takes the catch easily
143kph, good length into leg stump, he clips this nicely behind square, they run hard pushing for three and take on the throw and just beat it
140kph, fuller length angled into off, he defends on the front foot to mid off
140kph good length wide of off, he pushes at it, gets a thick inside edge that runs to the gap at square leg
141kph, good length, he's half forward defending off the edge and it runs along the ground to third slip
good length, angled into the top of off, he defends on the front foot
137kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot
133kph, good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
139kph, good length, angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot again
136kph, swinging down leg, it clips the pad and flies through to Paine who takes it well diving to his right
136kph, bouncer over middle, he ducks underneath it
good length angled across and he defends on the front foot to mid off
139kph, good length wide of off, nipping back in but wide enough to leave
143kph, good length, top of off, he's defending half forward with soft hands
142kph, back of a length outside off and climbing, he raises the bat high and lets it go. Paine takes it way above his head
good length, fifth stump line, 142kph, he lets this go again
139kph, wider of off, good length, he leaves out of the hand
143kph, back of a length, angled into the hip, too quick for him as it hits the thigh guard and drops down
133kph, good length but a leg stump line, he clips this nicely square of midwicket for a couple
139kph, fuller away swinger, tempting the drive, he is tempted and it shapes past the outside edge
138kph, good length outside off, he defends on the front foot to mid off
139kph, good length, angled across the left-hander but he gets a good stride in and defends on the front foot
good length outside off, he defends on the front foot
shorter into the ribs, he's back and tucking this around the corner very well
140kph, fuller into middle and leg and he pushes this nicely with the angle wide of mid on for a couple
141kph, shorter length, he's back and across and defends with soft hands
140kph, off the shoulder of the bat again but it goes to ground sooner and runs fine of gully towards third man. Another quick ball climbing off a length and catching the edge
fuller on the pads, he works this towards mid on
141kph, good length outside off, he makes a positive stride into the ball and pushes this to the gap at cover
good length, fifth stump line, he leaves this alone
86kph, off break on middle, he closes the face and gets a leading edge back towards the bowler

Given LBW! Thirimanne has reviewed. It looked straight. He delivered an off break on off stump, he played around his front pad again but it slid on rather than turning away and crashed into the front pad. No bat involved. Ball tracking has it bouncing over! He survives! The decision is overturned. Good review. That looked out live
86kph, tossed up on off, similar line, he defends with the full face
89kph, close to off, he closes the face again defending against the turn
88kph, full outside off, he defends with soft hands to silly mid off
89kph, with dip and curve, he is forward to smother the spin and bounce
138kph, back of a length, nipping back, he's defending from the crease taking the bottom hand off the bat
shorter length, nipping back, tucking him up, he gets a little inside edge onto thigh guard
141kph, back of a length angling down leg, it clips the thigh pad and runs fine for four leg byes
141kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
140kph, good length targeting off, he defends off the sticker of the bat trying to get forward
fuller length, 141kph, wide of off, he leaves early, it hits the seam and nips back but it is wide of off
tossed up outside off, he stretches forward and defends with firm hands
he cuts and misses! Not that short and turning and bouncing, he flashed from the crease and missed
pushed through fuller outside off, he leaves as it slides on
shorter, he's back and pushing off the back foot to cover
tossed up wide of off, he leaves this alone as it spins and bounces away
loop and drop outside off, he defends on the front foot
back of a length, climbing, he's back and taken on the gloves but it drops down
beaten, squared up outside off. Good length angled in, he's caught on the crease, it nips away past the edge
141kph, bouncer, wide of off, he sways under it early
big LBW appeal, not out is the call. No review. it was fast and nipping back but going down leg
good length wide of off, he leaves this alone

caught at second slip! Brilliant from Cummins and another catch for Burns. He'd been pushing him back and back with fast, back of a length stuff. This is pitched up outside off, enticing the drive, he is lured in, pushes from the crease without good weight transfer, gets the edge and it's straight into the bread basket for Burns. He pouches it easily
86kph, good length off break, he steps forward and defends on the front foot
tossed up outside off, he leaves
shorter outside off, he punches off the back foot to cover
looped up on off, he presses forward and defends
short and wide and he mistimes a cut to point
drifting into leg, he turns this against the spin wide of mid on for one
length ball on off stump, and angling inwards. Nudged off his hips to the leg side
length ball on off stump, from over the wicket. Worked off his knees to backward square for a single
full, round the wicket, but landing just outside off. Thirimanne presses forward to drive to cover. Not off the bat's sweet spot though
back of a length just outside off, and he rides the bounce to block off the back foot
back of a length outside off, but the searing delivery soars over his shoulder and into Paine's gloves
length ball, too wide outside off, and he happily lets it go
length ball on leg stump, and spinning further down leg
length ball on middle, and offbreak goes across the batsman and down the leg side again
length ball, but wider outside off stump. Spins inwards, and left alone after covering his stumps
length ball on middle, and it hits his body while he tries to shoulder his arms. Ball flies to Starc at leg slip, but it came off his hips
length ball, wide outside off but turning into offstump. Defended off the back foot
tossed up, full just outside off, and he stretches forward to block
full on middle stump, and clipped firmly in front of square. Chase for midwicket to the boundary, but he manages to pull the ball back
full outside off, and he reaches away from his body to drive. Mistimed to cover
full on middle, and the on-drive is inside-edged towards the leg side. Squirted to midwicket for a single
back of a length on middle, cramping the batsman up. Uncomfortably worked away - off his face - to the leg side, as they scamper across for one
length ball on off, and the back-foot punch is inside edged to deep backward square
length ball outside off, and shaping slightly away. Rises with the bounce to punch, but misses the shot altogether
half-tracker outside off, but turning inwards. Nudged off the back foot to midwicket
full just outside off, and driven along the ground to mid-on for a jogging single
full outside off, from round the wicket. Turns further away, and he leaves it alone
full on leg stump, and straightening after pitching. Tries to nudge it behind square off the front foot, but the shot finds square leg
full outside off, and the attempted cover drive is inside-edged. Squirted to deep midwicket on this occasion
full, on middle, and defended away to the leg side off the front foot
back of a length on middle, tucking the batsman up. Tries to work it towards the leg side, but hits his body and rolls away for a single
full outside off, and angling further away. Takes some extra bounce after hitting the deck, and Paine has to stretch upwards in a bid to collect the ball
back of a length on leg, and he rocks back to fend off the back foot
full on middle, and driven with the bat's open face. Races past the non-striker, and even mid-off, but Burns gives the ball a chase and manages to pull it back
back of a length on middle, and he tiptoes to nudge a shot to the leg side
length ball on leg stump, and worked off his pads to the fielder at midwicket. Enough time to pinch a single
back of a length on off, and the short ball is left alone by Mendis. Drinks
length ball, outside the stumps, and left alone
length ball, just outside off, and he tries to get his bat out of the way, but eventually bunts this towards point. In two minds...
length ball, wide outside off and angling slightly away. Left alone once more
full just outside off, ball staying low as it angles inwards. Dananjaya covers his off stump, and then shoulders his arms
full and wide outside off, and he frees his arms to drive. Well struck, but stopped by Head at cover!
edged, but drops just short of Paine! Fuller, outside off again, and the check-drive takes a touch off the outside edge. Soft hands ensure that the ball doesn't stay in the air for too long
back of a length, wide enough outside off for the batsman to throw his hands at it. Check-punches through point for a few
stinker! Back of a length on middle, and getting big on the batsman while angling across him. Dananjaya fishes for a shot, before eventually pulling his bat back
back of a length on off, and he shapes up to pull along the ground. Protection in the deep though
length ball on middle, and he rides the bounce to tap the ball away towards the off side

a metre of daylight between ball and pads but the umpire gives it as leg byes! Full outside leg stump, and swinging further down leg. Paine can't hold on to it either as the delivery rolls away to the fine-leg boundary
length ball on leg stump, and the ball hits his guts as he misses a leg-side nudge
full on off, and he prods forward to defend
length ball on middle, and tapped off the back foot to cover. They go for a quick single, and the throw at the batsman's end hits the back of Dananjaya's right leg
back of a length outside off, and he shapes up to pull/hook. But completely misses the shot
length ball on middle, and he stays on the back foot to defend to Jhye
length ball, wide outside off, and angling further away. Left alone
full and wide outside off stump. Happy to see it go into Paine's gloves
length ball aimed at off stump, and blocked off the back foot rather comfortably
wayward! Length ball on leg stump, and going further down leg. Good work from Paine to dive to his right and intercept
length ball on middle, and angling into his pads. Nudged off his pads to square leg off the back foot
length ball on off, and defended towards the leg side after tiptoeing
full toss, 147.5kph and driven to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle, and the ball generates some extra bounce as it goes down the leg side and into Paine's safe gloves
full on middle, and defended with the bat's straight face
back of a length on middle, and he's late to pull. Top-edged, but falls short of Starc at fine leg
length ball on leg stump, and straightening after pitching. Looks to defend for the ball angling away, so he plays outside the delivery's line. Ball hits his gut instead
full just outside off, and he presses forward to defend towards short cover
length ball on middle, and he rocks back to defend
full on middle, from round the wicket. Ball angling into his pads, and flicked to square leg off the front foot. Finds the fielder though
back of a length on off, and spinning into the batsman. He shoulders his arms and allows it go to down leg
length ball just outside off, but not spinning as much. Tapped away with soft hands to the leg side
length ball outside off, and smothered with the spin to the leg side off the back foot
length ball on leg stump, and Dananjaya skips down the ground before padding the ball away to short leg
full on leg, and Dananjaya skips down the ground, before muscling a shot over midwicket. Shouts of 'catch it' there
length ball on middle, and steered off the back foot to cover after making some room. No boundaries scored for 154 balls now
full, just outside off, and shaping slightly away. Dananjaya attempts to drive, bu the ball goes past his edge
full on leg stump, and going further down. Dananjaya misses the flick off his pads with the ball going away from him
length ball outside off, teasing delivery that he chooses to cut. But the ball's moving away, and he misses the shot this time too
back of a length outside off, and he covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
full and wide outside off, bowled from wide of the crease. Means the ball's coming inwards, but it's still nowhere near the stumps. Shoulders his arms, Dananjaya

confident, he is! Using the width of the crease again. Bowls full, very full... and the ball landing on off stump can't be dug away by Dananjaya. He's too late to get his bat down, and the ball has gone crashing into the stumps. ,Australia five away from victory
full on leg stump, and nudged past the fielder at short leg
full on middle, and he paddles this fine to the fielder at third man
full outside off stump, and he goes down on one knee to sweep. Top-edged, but safe at midwicket
length ball, just outside off, and he cuts behind square to deep point
full on leg stump, and he can't wedge this away to the leg side. Ball hits his pad and flies away to the off side
full on middle, and blocked away to the off side. Also time for a short break... it's tea!
138kph, full angled down leg, he clips this away to wide fine leg with ease
139kph, short down leg, and he glances off the hip fine and it races to the short boundary!
good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
143kph, shorter length down leg, he goes to glance but withdraws the bat
144kph, short and way wide, he slashes at a cut shot but misses
144kph, fuller outside off, he pushes on the front foot to mid off
130kph, good length angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot
138kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves on the front foot through to Paine

given out caught behind! Thirimanne reviews. Angled in, nipping away, he pushes on the front foot and there's a sound as it flies to Paine. The Australians celebrate. Umpire Erasmus gives it out. There was nothing on hot spot. But a tiny spike on snicko according to the third umpire Michael Gough. But the spike was one frame behind the ball passing bat! The decision remains out!
good length, fifth stump line, he's back and across and defending into the off side
139kph, fuller and wider of off, he pushes on the front foot past point, they get a couple as this was reasonably well timed
this was short down leg and it deviated sharply away from Paine down the leg side for four byes!
138kph, full on the pads and he glances this extravagantly down to fine leg
145kph, from around the wicket, short angled into the body, he gets a thick inside edge jabbing at it that flies through square leg
140kph, shorter down the leg side and he misses trying to glance
142kph, shorter on off, he is back and across and defending towards mid on
141kph, good length, angled into the thigh guard, it comes off the thigh and drops down
shorter down the leg side, he tries to pull and misses
137kph, good length off stump line, he defends on the front foot
138kph, fuller and he edges a sliced drive short of the man in the gully
138kph, bouncer, well directed, he ducks under it late

beaten on the inside edge just past off stump! How did this miss? It hit the seam and jagged back a mile through the gate, it went over off stump, Paine dives and gets a glove on it to prevent four byes
back of a length, off stump line, he's back and defending from the crease
137kph, another bouncer, down the leg side and he barely has to duck to get out of the way
good length, angled into middle and off, he defends off the thick inside edge to square leg
fuller outside off, he drives on the up neatly through cover, nicely controlled stroke
141kph, back of a length on off, he's squared up a touch defending into the off side
138kph, bouncer, he tries to hook as he ducked! It flew way over his head
144kph, full outside off, he drives and gets a inside edge that flies past off stump and away for four!
136kph, shorter ball on off, he defends off the splice of the bat as it got big on him
beaten by a brute. 138kph, back of a length climbing outside off, he fends at it and it flies past the edge
139kph, back of a length wide of off, he defends away from his body off the back foot into the off side
back of a length, 140kph, wide of off, he leaves this alone
139kph, shorter on leg, he is back and working this through midwicket for a single
139kph, good length angled into the thigh guard, he can't make contact trying to work it to the leg side, it comes off his thigh
141kph, fuller angled into off stump he defends on the front foot
fuller out-swinger wide of off, he leaves this alone
130kph, fuller on leg, no shape, he glances this down to fine leg
135kph, good length wide of off stump, he leaves alone again
130kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
fuller and shaping back into off stump, he attempt to drives and drags it off the inside half of the bat to midwicket
shorter bouncer, he tries to upper cut and misses
136kph, full, almost a yorker length, on off, he squeezes this out towards point
136kph, bouncer, very high and he gets under it easily
140kph, back of a length on off, he defends off the back foot from the crease
137kph, fuller outside off, he leans into a drive but picks out cover-point
back of a length, 139kph, on off, he's squared up a touch defending to point
139kph, lifting delivery of off, he's up on his toes gloving this down from in front of his face
quick bouncer angled in towards middle, he sways underneath it
brilliantly ramped over the slips! What a shot! 135kph, short ball, he leans back, opens the face and lifts this up and over the cordon! Superb skill
134kph, short and swinging way down leg, Paine has to fly way to his right to reel it in one-handed
fuller, angling into leg stump, he gets an inside edge onto pad, it rolls behind square for a single
134kph, good length angled into off, straightening a touch, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
swing and a miss flashing at a drive way wide of off. He was beaten by the pace and late shape
140kph, wide full toss outside off, he actually leaves this, which is surprising
141kph, back of a length, just outside off, he is back and defending turning this through square leg for a single
beaten by a cracker! 148kph, angled in back of a length, it nips away and it climbs past the outside edge!
150kph, back of a length angled into middle, he turns this around the corner nicely behind square for a couple
148kph, shorter length outside off, he's up on his toes defending this towards mid on
147kph, fuller outside off, he drives firmly towards mid off
133kph, good length off stump line, he defends compactly from the crease to mid off
full and swinging into the front pad, they appeal for LBW, but it's not out. Definitely heading down the leg side
this is swatted over wide mid on with disdain! 134kph, length ball outside off, he frees the arms and swipes this cross batted over wide mid on for four! Some shot that!
137kph, bouncer, he drops the knees sways back and tries to ramp over slips again, but it flies past the bat
138kph, good length outside off, he plays a conventional forward defence to mid off

caught at backward square! Another short ball, Dickwella pulls this off the back foot, but rolled it flat and straight to the man placed near the umpire behind square, Harris reaches up and takes the catch easily!
length ball on off, and angling into Lakmal. He's cramped, but manages to evade much pain. Ball hits his thigh pad and rolls away
back of a length on middle, and once again coming into Lakmal. Tries to get away from the ball, but it hits him near his arm before rolling away to short fine leg
back of a length outside off, and he tries to flsh at this. Sticks his bat out to try and cut, but the ball's whizzed past it
full on leg stump, and while it hits Lakmal's pads, the ball is going down. Lakmal tries to swipe it away to the leg side, but the ball sneaks past his bat
full outside off stump, and Lakmal backs away slightly before trying to check-punch. Ball goes under his bat and into Paine's gloves
length ball on middle, and Lakmal can't nudge it square. Instead the ball hits the top of his pad and lobs into short leg's hands
back of a length, searing pace, getting big on Perera. Does well to put his bat near his face, and defend with soft hands
length ball, wide outside off, enticing Perera to slash at this. He goes hard for a cut, but misses the shot
back of a length just outside off, and he rides the bounce before steering a defensive shot to point
back of a length on middle, and he tiptoes to defend off the back foot

what a screamer! Patterson on debut... what a catch. Oh. My. God. Length ball just outside off, and the batsman tries to drive away from his body. Checks his shot as the ball takes an outside edge, and Patterson displays some epic flying time as he dives to his right from gully... and takes an amazing, one-handed catch at full stretch. #HangTime
full on middle, and clipped away, rather comfortably through midwicket
full, just outside off stump, and he splices a drive through the infield. They scamper across for two
length ball, just outside off stump, and Lakmal sticks his bat out. Ball flies past his outside edge to the keeper

big appeal for lbw, but not given! Starc's so dangerous against lower-order batsmen. Full on middle from round the wicket, and Lakmal misses the leg-side flick. Ball hits his front leg, impact's on leg stump, and that's what saves Sri Lanka
yorker on off stump, but Lakmal's attempted dig-away takes the inside edge to fine leg. They jog for a couple
full on off stump, and worked off the bat's toe-end to mid-on. All of it after ensuring he's gotten his toes out of the ball's way
length ball, wide outside off, and he cuts this to point while standing tall. Intercepted by the fielder behind square
length ball, just outside off, and he covers his off stump to defend
back of a length on middle, and he swivels to allow the ball to go past his armpits and into the keeper's gloves
leading edge but short of cover point. Length ball on middle, that he tries to work towards square leg. Instead the ball finds the bat's closed face and goes towards the other direction
length ball, just outside off, and he covers his stumps, before firmly blocking off the back foot
length ball, on the probing fourth-stump line. Chameera's attempted check-punch off the back foot doesn't make contact with the bat. Whizzes into Paine's gloves
back of a length just outside off, and he rides the bounce to bunt a punched shot to the fielder lurking at silly mid-off
flies over slip! Length ball from round the wicket, and Lakmal slashes hard at this one. Top-edged over the cordon... and Starc's unlucky spell continues
length ball, just outside off stump, and Lakmal can't make connection while trying to steer this square off the back foot
back of a length, a testing short ball that Lakmal chooses to duck under
back of a length, wide outside off but angling inwards. Lakmal makes some room before bunting this away to the off side
full on off, and he whips this away - off his toes - to midwicket
back of a length outside off, and tapped off the back foot past point for a single. He'll keep strike
back of a length outside off, and he cuts off the back foot past the infield. Chase for Head from point, but he retrieves it well inside the boundary
back of a length on middle, aimed at the batsman's body, and Chameera does very well to duck under this ball
length ball, just outside off, and punched off the back foot to coer
full just outside off, and he drives away from his body. Well struck, going over cover, and once again some hard yards for the fielder running towards the boundary
swish! That's the sound the ball would've made as it goes past Lakmal's ears. Back of a length, just outside off, and almost unplayable
back of a length on middle, and he tries to pull, but gloves it instead. In the air between leg gully and the keeper, but the ball lands safe!
yorker attempted at off stump's base, but Lakmal brings his bat down and digs it away to the off side
back of a length, wide outside off, and hammered through point with disdain! Fetch that
full outside off, and he goes for the lower-order-batsman style heave over cover. Clears his front leg for a slog, but misses the ball completely
clobbered! Not good for Starc's confidence either. Full just outside off, and muscled over cover! Fielder dived to his right in a bid to take a catch, but that was hit way too hard
back of a length on leg stump, and he tries to pull, but the ball hits the top of his bat and lobs away towards the leg side
back of a length on middle, and he slaps an inside-out flat-batted shot to cover
length ball on off, and he skips down the wicket before padding a shot to the leg side

flighted on middle, and Lakmal's attempted defensive shot comes off the pad and lobs into the air. Marnus runs towards the bowler's end to try and take an one hander, but the ball falls just beyond him
half-tracker on off, and pulled with the spin to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, and defended off the back foot towards the non-striker
stumped! And Australia win by an innings and 40 runs. Full on middle, and turning inwards. He skips down the wicket to slog, but the ball goes through him and then Paine does the rest.
